review.reviewBody: I just moved to Salt Lake City and needed a jacket that would encourage me to get out and go for a walk during the winter. It’s like wearing a sleeping bag. I am so so thankful i bought it. I also bought an outdoor research jacket that was shorter and has a gortex shell. I believe the gortex does help keep the warm in, will obviously protect against wind and rain, but the length of this one makes a difference. It’s still very warm despite not having the gortex outter and the length really does add a component of warmth to my legs and body. Highly recommend
review.name: The warmth you need

review.reviewBody:
I'm so happy with this jacket. I've never had a long coat. I use this jacket for cold days, hikes, and snowmobiling back and forth to my house (yes we live in one of those communities) and I wear it so I don't have to wear snow pants. It protects my legs and butt while out there. It has three zips (one in front and two on sides), so you can do almost
 anything while wearing it. It is light but warm. I got the off-white color and love it so much!
review.name: Why didn't I buy this years ago?

review.reviewBody: This jacket is perfect for very cold temperatures without the heaviness of a warm coat. I am pleasantly surprised how warm it keeps me without being bulky and heavy. Very easy to move in. The side zippers are a bonus. Love this coat!
review.name: Warmth Without the Bulk

review.reviewBody: Bought this for a 2 week winter trip in Norway and Svalbard and it kept me plenty warm! Don’t forget those wool layers underneath though. For being so lightweight it helped keep the wind from cutting through and held up on windy boat tours. I did see a couple feathers pop out here and there but nothing major. I bought the black version and it did pick up a couple mysterious stains but I really did put it through the wringer. The puffy hood was really nice but didn’t cinch to my face very well so when it was extra windy I layered a fleece hood underneath, highly recommend.
review.name: Arctic Ready

review.reviewBody: This is the warmest coat I have ever worn. I am a teacher and have to spend at least an hour outside each day helping to run the drop off line. Our weather in Indiana is varied, but we can get sub zero temps, and this has done the best job of any coat I have owned. Highly recommend.
review.name: Amazing Warmth

review.reviewBody:
Incredibly warm and comfortable! With a few tweaks, I’d give it five stars but it’s not quiiite there. I’d like to see the sizing a bit more consistent - it definitely runs large and even the XS has room to spare for me when I normally wear a Small in OR tops. I’d also love a slicker outer material; the current fabric is matte and does tend to pick up lint and hair more easily than a slick fabric would. However, those are small gripes. The parka is SO warm and cozy.
Just perfect for truly cold winter weather or gusty chilled winds. The hood and baffled neck keep out cold and all the little touches down to the zipper pulls and soft lined deep pockets make this feel like a really high end garment. It’s worth the retail price but I managed to get mine half off during a big sale and I feel like I won the lottery with it!
review.name: Warm and “coze” with a few small caveats

review.reviewBody: true to its descriptions, I used this last Feb in Seoul, South Korea where they have Siberian Chills. it kept me warm, too warm as I have put lots of laters..
review.name: I used this in Seoul, South Korea in winter

review.reviewBody: The most amazing comfy parka for cold weather. Too warm for temperate climates, but for winter in the rocky mountains it's perfect! So perfect, I own it in three colors.
review.name: My third one....

review.reviewBody: I’m always cold and this is the perfect jacket for me. I’m 5’3” and can comfortably wear it without feeling like swimming in it.
review.name: So warm!

review.reviewBody: I bought this to replace my DKNY puffy jacket. I’m a soccer mom, baseball mom, cheer mom… you get it. Lots of sideline sports. This jacket is an absolute sports mom’s dream! It’s light but extra warm and cozy. It’s water resistant, so even when it rains I am dry. It does run big, so size down or go with your regular size and have more room for layers.
review.name: Ultimate Sports Mom Jacket

review.reviewBody: I bought this as a "just in case" bag, meaning I take it with me when traveling in case I need extra baggage room.
review.name: GET THIS BAG

review.reviewBody: Great snowboarding backpack with hydration pouch for your hydration bottle, luv it, get one while you can!
review.name: Ideal 18 L packable

review.reviewBody: I bought three Cotopaxi items for my co-workers for Christmas gifts. We were out at lunch and when I handed them out, their reaction would have been a perfect advertisement for your company. The man I work with, "I LOVE Cotopaxi"! One of the women, "How did you know how great these are?". Last woman, "I don't have any but now I want more". So thank you!
review.name: Cotopaxi winning

review.reviewBody: I bought this backpack for my boss as a gift and he loves it!! It’s beautiful and colorful and excellent quality, I would recommend it to hikers. I might get one for myself!
review.name: Great lightweight hiking backpack!

review.reviewBody: I loved the first one so much I bought another one. It’s perfect for day hikes, straps are comfortable, lightweight and sturdy. I bring it on all my road trips. You can easily roll it up and store it when not in use
review.name: My second Luzon backpack

review.reviewBody: What a great backpack! It holds my water bladder and the rest of my hiking needs perfectly. And it's so cute! I could not have gotten better colors.
review.name: Exactly what I needed

review.reviewBody: Got this to manage my climbing gear to and from the gym/spot. It came folded up in its own stuff sack, I thought they'd forgot it in the package! Super light, packs down and has a lot of space for stuffing in your gear. I like the drawstring top so I'm not busting zippers. Kind of wished it was a roll top to accommodate different size loads and a side pocket for a bottle, but I knew that going in. Took away a star 'cause I'm a tough guy ;)
review.name: Sweet little gear bag!

review.reviewBody: A great day pack but also for short trips! Easy to pack main compartment.
review.name: Perfect for my needs

review.reviewBody: I would have liked a better top closure with a zipper.
review.name: I would have liked a

review.reviewBody: I really love this backpack. The colors are really cool. It's the perfect size for me and what I intended it for, day hikes. I wanted something to put layers in as I peel them off and or add them as needed. Added a water bladder. Also first aid, compass, snacks, etc. Plenty of room. Also the waist strap and chest strap were a must have.
review.name: Cool pack

name: Luzon Del Dia 18L Backpack

review.reviewBody:
Was thrilled to find this model of Olukai's, as I had pair for close to 10 years that finally had to retired! Great price, great delivery. 
A note on fit. I have a wide foot and needed to go up to full size. I'm usually a 9 wide shoe and the 10 fit across my instep very comfortably.
review.name: Just as good as the 1st pair I wore out!

review.reviewBody: My last pair of Olukai’s finally wore out after years of use. The heals delaminated and the leather wore out. I decided to decided to give the waterproof more synthetic ones a try. What I really like about the sandals is the arch support. They dry easily if you walk in the water.     And Very comfortable!
review.name: So far so good

review.reviewBody: After searching for arch support flip flops, and being throughly disappointed, I found Olukai.  Since purchasing I have literally lived in these.  And being semi retired, that is a lot more time than usual.  I now only wear shoes when I have to go to work.  The quality and especially the comfort of these is the highest I have ever experienced with flip flops.  A bit more expensive than all others I have bought, but Oh So Worth It!  I'm saving money on shoes and getting comfort and breathability in return.  Will definitely purchase more when these start to show wear and tear.  I can't recommend these enough!!
review.name: A better life with Olukai

review.reviewBody: These are my go to in the summer.   Great arch support and very well made.   On 3rd pair of these.  They are that good.
review.name: Dog ate my other ones.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Theses sandals are really well made. When I got them in I couldn't wait to wear them. They were a little snug for the first two days. Once I broke them in they were so comfy. They are perfect to wear out and about and also on the beach. I want to get my dad a pair I think he would really enjoy theses.
review.name: Comfy shoes

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These Hokua flip flops are well made with sturdy material! I know I will get a lot of use out of these once the weather warms up! Great that they are water resistant as I can wear them when I go fishing without any problem!
review.name: well made!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] As a flip-flop fanatic (even my golf shoes are flip-flops), I feel these are the best pair I've ever worn. The craftsmanship, attention to detail, and great arch support contribute to an exceptional product. Do your feet a favor; buy them!
review.name: Exceptional!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I got these sandals about 2 weeks ago and they are great. They are very comfortable and look great.  I like the extra padding that they have in them so that your feet don't get sore after wearing them for awhile.
review.name: Very comfortable sandal

name: Hokua Flip Flop - Men's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Really love this new Dock Hangout from Bote! It's a great lounger that blows up quick and we really love the back cushion. Can't wait to add more of these to configure a bigger lounge area for our crew. Great design, perfect for the lake or salt water!
review.name: Lake lounger!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great quality. Perfect for the lake. For lounging at the dock or floating at the boat with friends. Room to add the cooler and keep traffic off the boat during a long float day. I'm 350lb and sit on the edge no sinking, sagging, or flipping.
review.name: Great for the lake and amazing quality.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] We bought this for a gift for our parents for the river. It had so many purposes… tanning, wrestling, lunch table and a slip and slide! It’s super sturdy and can tolerate a lot of weight. Definitely a great purchase!! Will buy more of your products!
review.name: We bought this for a

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Super durable quality design. Super stable for 3 adults and when you strap another couch to it 6 or 7. Super fun product.
review.name: Super fun product

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I knew I’d be impressed with the quality of the product. It didn’t disappoint. From the packaging, instructions, super easy inflate, and the overall quality and design and outstanding.
review.name: Very impressed, quality design, love it!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Fabulous and fun. The hand pump was easy to use and super fast. Very efficient. The dock and lounge pillow are high quality, and the speaker was a key add-on, with sturdy magnetic bases placed in convenient points on the dock. Deflating after the weekend was a breeze. A ton of fun for a few minutes of setup!
review.name: Fabulous and fun

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I absolutely love the hangout couch! I bought it for our pool and love being able to lounge on it and be able to keep drinks, books, etc on it without them getting wet. Our dog even loves floating around on it!
review.name: Great for the pool

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The valves are white instead of yellow like our chairs. The white ones don't work properly.
review.name: Valves are bad

review.reviewBody: I love the PreCipice Eco Jacket and have several in different colors.  I'm 5'5", 125 pounds and wear a large to fit sweaters underneath.  It's slightly tapered, which gives a slenderizing appearance and hits just below the buttocks.  My only disappointment/complaint is the white lining/coating starts to disintegrate and flake after a few years, which causes white specks all over my clothing....not pretty....and thus the 4 star rating.
review.name: Great jacket, but...

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The girlfriend loves it.   Great Color.  Great fit.
review.name: Great color, great fit

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Does what it should. Fits good- a little loose than expected.
review.name: Nice jacket

review.reviewBody: This is my second jacket as I lost my first- love this slimming too.  Bought in black.
review.name: Perfect Rain Jacket

review.reviewBody: Can't complain because when I bought it the price was 50%..but to evaluate the quality and size of the MARMOT brand, it's not as good...as the Marmot raincoat I bought 4 years ago...
review.name: MARMOT PreCip Eco Jacket

review.reviewBody: I needed a new lightweight rain jacket, and was looking for something that 1. had pit zips, and 2. would pack down for an easy camping/travel option. I have always loved my heavier Marmot ski jacket, and this rain jacket 100% fits the need! So much attention to detail! Ordered the XS - it's loose enough to throw a few layers underneath if needed.
review.name: Perfect Packable Layer!

review.reviewBody: I've had this jacket for three years and have probably worn it less than 50 times. The first couple of times I wore it as a windbreaker and it was perfectly fine; the first time I wore it in the rain I got soaked through but by then it was too late to return. Since then it has kept me dry in a drizzle but harder rain tends to go through the jacket. The lining also started shedding about a year ago, just little bits of white material at first but now when I take the jacket off I'm covered in flakes. Really disappointed in the quality and will be staying away from Marmot products in the future!
review.name: not waterproof, lining sheds

review.reviewBody: I have owned two Precip Eco jackets previously.  They are light weight, come in nice colors,  and worked well for travel.  The first year or two they work great to keep me dry, but the water repellency wears off after that time.  After a rainstorm, I noticed my arms were wet underneath the jacket.  I read that washing with conventional detergent damages water repellency.  I have tried treating them with Nik Wax, but it may have been too late.  In each case, I just purchased a new one.   Returning this because it runs small through the middle and the hips.  I need a size L.
review.name: Almost Perfect

review.reviewBody: Keeps me super dry, is packable and light, it is a must have for a summer hike, but also works as a great dry layer over a sweater.  I am a big fan.
review.name: Cannot Beat it for the Price!

review.reviewBody: I tested out my Marmot rain jacket in the Monongahela mountains during a 3 day backpacking trip. It rained on us 80% of the time BUT this jacket kept me relatively dry!
review.name: relatively dry

name: PreCip Eco Jacket - Women's

review.reviewBody: The size was fine for me, but the jacket arrived with a defective zipper, so I had to return.  Also, the jacket is very thin, so would not recommend for skiing in New England.
review.name: Thin shell jacket

review.reviewBody:
These honestly appear to be cut like Men's sizes.  I followed the chart and according to it, I should have been a large.  For reference I'm 5'8" / 150 lbs and a size 10 (36 B/C).  I have fairly long arms and legs and the arms on this went about 5-6 inches too long.  I also absolutely SWAM in this thing, even taking layering into consideration.  Still, I thought it looked decent for the $67 deal I received.  I called and arranged the exchange.  Well, they screwed that up and sent yet another Large when I had asked for a Medium (knowing that too, was gonna be oversized).

After reading the other reviews and having inspected the garment before sending back, I agree with those reviewers who said that it was not waterproof or even water resistant.  It's more like a soft cotton/twill shell.  I can't speak to whether the seams were sealed as they claim, but I can say with certainty there was nothing water resistant to the fabric itself.  After reading about zipper issues and everything else, I went ahead and arranged for yet another return.  

Both times i had to drive these packages to the nearest FedEx box, which was a hassle.  I asked for them to pick it up from my house on the second merry-go-round and was told they could not offer that.  I told them, "I should've guessed that would be the case" as this is Steep and Cheap.
review.name: Ignore Size Chart - Massively Oversized

review.reviewBody: I really liked this jacket in terms of the style and the quality of the material of the jacket, but the zipper was plastic and it broke after 6 uses.
review.name: zipper broke

review.reviewBody: I bought this deeply discounted and for the price I paid think it’s great, however as one reviewer said it is more like a lightweight rain jacket HOWEVER it is not at all water proof or even resistant! I wore it to shovel on a snowy day and I was soaked through. It is cute and like the oversized fit but it’s best worn on a blue bird day or spring conditions. The pockets are however ample so I kept it and do enjoy it but set your expectations, this is not a Dec-Feb Jacket.
review.name: Spring conditions lightweight

review.reviewBody: Layered with a good base and mid layer, it keeps you warm and dry and looks good, too. Runs a little large so I ended up returning my medium for a small. Careful with the zipper, as it can get stuck, but great shell for the price!
review.name: Just what I needed

review.reviewBody:
It’s maybe not the best jacket ever but for 69 bucks it was great. I was looking for a shell to go over my puff layer and wool layer. And this great. The material feels great on my skin. A lot of the other reviews are saying it’s not a good winter coat, that it’s just a shell. But it’s advertised as a shell. So that’s what it is. 

If it ends up falling apart this ski season I’ll come back and change my review but so far this a lot better than my previous jacket.
review.name: I like it!

review.reviewBody: I purchased to try this on. Thought it might be a screaming deal - totally wrong. Not a ski coat, a very thin overly sized shell. I ordered a small because I am 5'2 and 120lbs - it fit like a large - like a dress. Photo also does not accurately depict the color shades. Thought it would be more yellow it's pale.
review.name: Don't Purchase

review.reviewBody:
This jacket is one of the most poorly-made articles of clothing I have ever purchased. This feels like an obvious cash-grab by listing the product at $219 and deeply discounting it. The seams certainly are not sealed, and it looks like water and wind would have no problem getting through them. If you want to market this as a budget soft-shell type jacket, fine. But this is NOT a ski/snowboard jacket, unless one is skiing indoors. 

I was very excited to buy this as a gift, but now cannot wait for my return to process. If Backcountry cares for quality control, they should take this product down.
review.name: Poor quality, a disgrace

review.reviewBody: This isn’t really a winter coat it’s more like a rain jacket. I’m 5’2” and purchased a Medium - it came down to above my knees and the sleeves went to my fingertips. Every time I bent over the bottom zipper would start to unzip. It’s good looking jacket but unless you’re built like model and are trying to wear a few more layers underneath for warmth I would not recommend.
review.name: Not a winter coat

review.reviewBody: Found ourselves in a last-minute crunch for a bike rack for a trip. A friend recommended this Yakima FullBack, so we ordered and we paid for expedited shipping. The expedited option said shipping would take 2-days and given the bulk/weight of this item I was skeptical that it would arrive that quickly. I did a chat with Backcountry and they confirmed that 2-day was possible. And to our complete relief that's exactly what happened! Though the product went from UT to TN before delivery in CA, it all happened in 2 days. Installation of the rack on the back of our SUV was pretty straightforward, rack is solid and reliable as long as you follow instructions, and be sure when they tell you to go to the fit guide on Yakima's website to get extra instructions for your particular vehicle that you do it! Anyway, Backcountry is now my default, go-to outdoor/rec equipment resource. THANK YOU BACKCOUNTRY!!
review.name: Rack is good, Backcountry is awesome

name: FullBack 3 Trunk Rack

review.itemreviewed: Forte Endless Promise Sleeping Bag: 20 Deg  - Women's
review.reviewBody: Ive had a forte men long for a while now. I love it ! Im a woman 5ft7 180 lbs. Ive got plenty of room in my mens forte. I bought a women forte so I can give my men's forte to my boyfriend who is 6ft. I tought it would be similar. It is not. I feel too tight, cant move around in it. Also there are two zippers instead of one for the vents , it tends to get stuck.. So disapointed.. Might check for a tempo men instead.. or buy the forte men again..
review.name: Disapointed

review.itemreviewed: Forte Endless Promise Sleeping Bag: 20 Deg  - Women's
review.reviewBody: Bought one for my wife and one for me last fall. First time using them (June 2024). We got the 20 degree bags as she sleeps cold. Last night got down to 55 and both of us were uncomfortably cold - 35 degrees warmer than the rating.  Will likely look for other options. I was really hoping theses would be a great fit for us,  but not.
review.name: Disappointed in temp ratung
comment: Thank you for taking the time to leave a review but I'm sorry to hear about this experience! The standardized testing used to assign temperature ratings to sleeping bags (the ISO Test) provides three temperature thresholds to help guide users, a COMFORT rating, a LIMIT rating, and an EXTREME rating. The names can be a bit misleading, but the reason for offering all three is because sleep comfort is a very personal preference, and whether you sleep warm or cold at night determines how much insulation you need in your bag. Be on the lookout for an email from our customer service team. Thank you again for the review!

review.itemreviewed: Forte Endless Promise Sleeping Bag: 20 Deg  - Women's
review.reviewBody: Big NEMO fan here and loving my new Forte.  I love how easy it is to care for this synthetic bag.  The pillow pocket is such a great feature - I can stuff my jacket in there if I don't bring a camp pillow with me.  Also, my boyfriend can zip his NEMO bag together with mine!
review.name: Durable, Comfortable, and Sustainable

review.itemreviewed: Forte Endless Promise Sleeping Bag: 20 Deg  - Women's
review.reviewBody: I was so excited when I read the reviews and description of this sleeping bag. I am a side sleeper and have found my other mummy bags restricting and hard to sleep on my side. I was so comfortable and impressed with this bag. It kept me extra warm. I liked having a stuff bag to pack the sleeping bag into as well as a storage bag when left at home. I’d highly recommend this sleeping bag!
review.name: Fabulous bag for side sleepers.

review.itemreviewed: Forte Endless Promise Sleeping Bag: 20 Deg  - Women's
review.reviewBody:
I have the same complaint as some others about having gendered zippers. It doesn't make sense when other companies offer the choice of zipper on the left or right, especially if you're emphasizing that your bags can be zipped together. You're alienating your queer customer base. I've seen those comments from years ago that you're "doing something about it". Do better, Nemo.

Not to mention that once I did actually zip my Forte up with another Forte (men's endless promise), my zipper was several inches longer despite both being the long size.

And after my first trip, the material in the heat vents has caught in the zipper, rendering it useless. Great idea (we did use them) but poor execution.
review.name: Cozy but zipper issues
comment: Thank you so much for your feedback! The significant difference between men's and women's bags are the temperature ratings — women's bags are rated to an EN Comfort standard, which sleep a little warmer. However, you are correct that the temperature ratings, sizes and zippers do not need to be gender-based, and while this has been the standard naming convention within the industry in the past, it is definitely something we are looking at changing. We'll reach out to you directly regarding the zipper on the Thermo Gill™ vents getting caught. That is certainly something that we can help with.

review.itemreviewed: Forte Endless Promise Sleeping Bag: 20 Deg  - Women's
review.reviewBody: I was looking for a sleeping bag that would keep me warm in upper 30/lower 40 degree weather, wasn't as constricting as a mummy bag, and had a zipper that wouldn't get stuck when I was trying to get out of it. The Nemo Forte definitely checked all of those boxes. I used it on my last camping trip and had the best night of sleep I've ever had camping. The separate storage mesh and compression bags are also nice to have. I had some trouble stuffing into the compression bag but my husband had no trouble at all. I definitely recommend this bag and the male Forte bag.
review.name: Great upgrade from my previous bag.

review.itemreviewed: Forte Endless Promise Sleeping Bag: 20 Deg  - Women's
review.reviewBody: Im SUPER pleased with mine! Soft, squishy, and WARM!!
review.name: Snug as a bug!!

review.itemreviewed: Forte Endless Promise Sleeping Bag: 20 Deg  - Women's
review.reviewBody: Absolutely love the women’s Forte spoon bag after years of struggling to sleep in a mummy bag. The only downfall, and one that continues to bother me, is the right-side only zipper. Please make a left zip option! I want a women’s specific bag, but I sleep on my left and it is awkward with that right zip and is the only thing that keeps this bag from being the best ever.
review.name: Women’s Forte

review.itemreviewed: Forte Endless Promise Sleeping Bag: 20 Deg  - Women's
review.reviewBody: So that my major organs don’t have my weight on them, I sleep on my left side.  Mountain Hardwear bags give you a choice for zipper.  I gave the bag a low rating because of the zipper.  The quality looked good.
review.name: Sending Back
comment: Hello, thanks for the review, sorry to hear about your experience! Our dual-sided YKK zipper is offered in a longer length on one side for a few reasons.  The bag can zip up with another Forte, Riff or Disco, the longer length allows for ventilation from the footbox as well as use the bag as a quilt in warmer temperatures. If you have any questions, feel free to reach out to our CS team at Journey@NEMOEquipment.com!

review.itemreviewed: Forte Endless Promise Sleeping Bag: 20 Deg  - Women's
review.reviewBody: I have always been a fair weather camper and I think I will do more cool weather camping with this bag.
review.name: Love, love, love this bag

name: Forte Endless Promise Sleeping Bag: 20 Deg  - Women's

review.reviewBody: -30F approved.  I spent days searching for a lost dog in ultra cold weather and also camping with this jacket.  I was good in -30.  My husband and I both have this jacket (he has the men's version).  It is a very warm jacket.  I highly recommend a wicking layer underneath your clothes because once you get moving, you'll sweat a bit.  Also, size up from what your t-shirt size is so it has enough room to loft.  I wear a Medium T-shirt, and sometimes a Large and I got a large.
review.name: So warm, great quality.

review.reviewBody: Great weight to warmth ratio but sacrifices durability. Outer fabric rips super easily and is not very water resistant.. The niche for this jacket is dry cold only without any exposure to rocks or rough surfaces.. A very expensive niche for the price point
review.name: Light but not robust

review.reviewBody:
The Mythic Ultra is quite warm, and it did well in the recent bout of single digit temperatures. That said, it doesn't quite match the warmth of my previous down jacket bought in Scandinavia over 20 years ago, and I doubt it will last half as long! 

I use it just for normal wear around town and occasional festival (I'm not a sports person so it will not be used for any sports or outdoor activities)... so I did mull over the purchase for a while before deciding.. it's quite a lot of money! But I did need a warm jacket to face the winter, so here we are. 

I've been using it for 3 weeks and it has done OK. The Orion blue/orange combo is very nice, and the sizing is generous - only the sleeves are too long for me as I'm quite petite.. but I'm used to that problem. 

The big issue with it: it sheds a lot of the feathers/down! At this rate, the Mythic will be nothing but a fabric shell in 5 years time. Disappointing, for the price.
review.name: The Mythic Ultra is quite

review.reviewBody: This is a great jacket. I wore the men’s XL most of last winter including six weeks of skiing Alta/Snowbird in some of the biggest powder days of my life. My wife started bundling up in my jacket at night and this week we bought her one of her own. The sizing chart said she was either a XL or a large because of her bust size (43”) and her wide shoulders. Well the large size was huge on her. So we ordered the medium size and it came today. It fits her perfectly. From my experience alpine skiing and snowshoeing in my XL jacket last winter, we know this is a fantastic jacket. Terrific warmth to weight ratio, extremely light, excellent zippers, good length, very well made and durable. My wife’s sizing dimensions are in the boxes. For the men’s XL, I’m 6’1”, 207 lbs., normal size shoulders, 34” to 35” shirt sleeves. XL fits me slightly loose. A large would be too small for me. Sleeves are too long on the XL. Perfect length of jacket body. I have a tall upper body. Only thing I’d do to improve the Mythic Ultra jacket is to add a large mesh inside pocket.
review.name: Warm, very light, fits big on women.

review.reviewBody: Beautiful and warm jacket. Was looking for something that would hold up in the outdoors with various sports. I’m not a huge fan of layering a lot underneath, so I ordered my normal size. When trying it on, I had no complaints except that it fit really big. Sleeves were long and and about an inch of room on either side of my hips. I have a pear shape, I’m 5’5” and 125lbs and ordered a small. I wasn’t seeing many reviews about the jacket running big on people, so I hope this is helpful! I think I’m going to reorder an X-small.
review.name: So warm and well made but fits big!

review.reviewBody: There a lot of down coming out of the stitching, wounding if needle size is too big in the manufacturing as I've never had this before in a RAB down product
review.name: There a lot of down

name: Mythic Ultra Jacket - Women's

review.reviewBody: Got this case, size small as a Christmas gift. There are no instructions on how to use it, or videos on how to use it. It doesn't seal at all. It's too small to be really that useful either. I fold it over and attach the velcro tabs, but then it just unrolls itself. I think I could make it work with a pair of Gator clips (one on each side) to keep it from unrolling. You would think it should do that on its own with our having to add pieces to it. So yeah, thumbs down here. It not returnable, so I'm going to trash this one and go buy another brand. Good luck all.

review.reviewBody: Great Trail shoe, rugged tread, handles the rocks, very comfortable and Looks great!
review.name: Rugged Trail Shoe

review.reviewBody: I bought this shoe 2 years ago.  I've easily hiked, jogged, or walked in this shoes well over 1200 miles.  Any other shoe would have fallen apart.  This is the most sturdy shoe I've ever worn, while still being extremely comfortable to wear every day.  This is the shoe I put on after a long hike in my St. Elias boots.  So glad I found these shoes.
review.name: Best Shoe.....

review.reviewBody:
1st size was too small.    Ordered 1:2 size up and fit perfectly.
Returned quickly and easy.   Good experience!
review.name: Great service

review.reviewBody: This Vasque product is a outstanding light hiking or walking shoe. I ended up buying 3 pairs of these for family after I purchased and loved the first pair.  A great product for Alaska
review.name: Outstanding Hiking Shoe Vaque Juxt

review.reviewBody: Poorly made shoes. stitching came apart on both shoes on the inside behind the toe box.  Pretty disappointed given the Vasque name.
review.name: Buy something else

review.reviewBody: I wore these shoes daily to work (in an office) as welll as around town, around the house, etc.  after a few weeks, both shoes developed a tear on the outside, in the suede, just behind the plastic toe cap.  I love the look and feel so much that I want to buy another pair but I’m concerned they will do the same thing.  You can see in the photos that the left shoe is worst than the right.  I put Gorilla Tape on the inside to keep the whole closed up.
review.name: Loved them for a minute.  Then this happened…
comment: Thank you for your honest review. I am sorry to hear your boots did not have a longevity up to your expectations. I will reach out direct to see if I can help. We hope you will give our brand another chance in the future.

review.reviewBody: I've trusted my life to these as a Former Special Operations Officer in the US Intelligence Community. I wore these as an operator for short duration direct action ops where strong ankle support was not essential. This was the approach shoe we wore on the Bin Laden raid.
review.name: Great approach shoe.
comment: What an awesome story! We value this moments and love hearing about them! We hope to continue being a part of your story.

review.reviewBody:
Vasquez hiking boots were the first pair of real hiking boots that I ever owned. Bought a pair when I was 16 years old and I am not going to tell you what year that was but needless to say they were the best real hiking boots that I have ever had the pleasure of owning. Since then I have searched high and low for a comparable pair both in price and quality. I don't mind spending a few dollars more if that translates to better quality. Unfortunately it doesn't. I have owned many different pairs from many different manufacturers but in the end it has come down to Vasque. In quality, performance and value for the dollar. Right now I own two pairs of the Juxt and they are almost 8 years old and still have at least another 5 years of life if not more. And they are my go to shoe, for daily wear casual as well as hiking. They are great approach shoes, sturdy, comfortable and trustworthy.
Thank you for keeping your product real and not falling victim to the least expensive outsourcing manufacturers that so many of your competitors have to there regrets.
Sincerely Brian B.
review.name: Till the end.
comment: Hello! Thank you for your review! We are happy to hear the footwear have lived up to your expectations! We hope that you continue to enjoy the Juxt line for future years to come!

review.reviewBody: Been a Vasque customer for decades, back when they were made in Italy, I was a bit hesitant to buy the Asian made sundowners I’ve grown to love from the mid 90’s. I was pleasantly surprised, they still have the perfect fit out of the box as they did in years past, to be honest I’ve never owned anything other than the sundowners, the juxt was the first different Vasque product I’ve bought, and I’m not disappointed! I may buy a second set for “date night” and another set for the trails!
review.name: NO BREAK IN NEEDED!
comment: Thank you for your review! I am glad to hear we have lived up to your expectations regarding the performance.  We hope that you continue to like the improvements and we can serve you in the future!  Thank you for your review!

review.reviewBody: I discovered this shoe about 10 years ago when I was living in South America, and it was the perfect shoe for both the street and dirt roads. Even now that I am back in the United States, I have continued to wear the shoe and only the shoe for almost a decade, every day. it’s very comfortable, especially if you have narrow feet and there’s plenty of room for the custom insoles that I wear. I literally keep several pairs of these new in the boxes in my basement just in case stop making them.
review.name: The only shoe I wear.
comment: Thank you for your review!  We're happy to hear your shoes have worked will for you with daily use.  We appreciate your support!

name: Juxt Hiking Shoe - Men's

description: Buy the HOKA Kaha 2 GTX Hiking Boot - Women's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Kaha 2 GTX Hiking Boot - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the HOKA Kaha 2 GTX Hiking Boot - Women's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Wore these all over Norway for a two week vacation and they were perfect for going from hiking to city street style. Would recommend!
review.name: exactly what I wanted

review.reviewBody: No break in needed, soft enough for my tender sensitive feet, easy to slip foot , great lacing system, really fantastic support on worn out ankles (I'm more stable in standing and walking), will have warmth in ankles as well, regular width is not too wide nor narrow, thick gripping soles is a big plus, I feel much less pain in knees and hips with this boot support. Black color is more of rich tone than a washed out look in the photo. Orthotics slides easily in. This is a winner for me. Thinking of buying another as backup incase.
review.name: Perfection for all the life long scars on my feet

review.reviewBody: Seems like a great shoe, although I wouldn't know because they were incredibly narrow.
review.name: Too. Narrow

review.reviewBody: I bought these for my daughter who works at a horse farm. She needed something waterproof, rugged enough to withstand doing barn chores all day, and comfortable enough to not have her feet aching at the end of the day. She loves them! Her feet are so comfortable and dry at the end of the day.
review.name: Great for being on your feet all day doing farm work

review.reviewBody: Though I bought my originally Hokas for hiking and photography, I fell in love with them so. I wore them out Tried a couple of other styles of Hoka them noticed these KAHA 2 GTX were a newer version of my beloved first pair. Love, love these mid-height boots. Lots of ankle support. The super plush is like walking on air I wear them all of the time. The lacing is easier and stays put. I bought the purple. The waterproof material makes them so easy to keep clean and my feet never get wet.
review.name: LOVE these KAHA 2GTX

review.reviewBody: Hiked up and down Kilimanjaro in these boots. I could trust the boots to grip when needed and was very comfortable in them. Would recommend.
review.name: Hiked up and down Kilimanjaro in these boots

review.reviewBody: I haven't actually been on a hike yet, but I have worn these hiking boots to teach in, and they are super comfortable. I have tried so many different brands of hikers, and these are the first ones that I have really liked. My feet did not hurt one bit after teaching all day long. I will buy another pair when I need them.
review.name: Great pair of hiking boots

review.reviewBody: I've tried SO MANY hiking boots. I thought the La Sportiva's I bought would work but when I started hiking more than 3 miles in them, after a long break-in period, my feet hurt. I practically gave up on hiking boots and figured I'd just wear my Hoka light trail running shoes for hikes. But I decided to hike Mount Kilimanjaro next summer and need to have hiking boots for the summit day that can get as cold as -25 Fahrenheit. I hiked 6 miles with 2,100 feet of elevation gain and loss on a tricky trail with roots, rocks, and bouldering in these boots yesterday and my feet were in heaven. These are wearable right out of the box. They're just what I hoped they'd be: like my super cushioned running Hokas but with the stability of a boot. I no longer need to worry about what boot I'll wear and can focus on training. I wear a 7.5 in my Hoka trail running shoes and the 7.5 in these fit just right.
review.name: Finally.

review.reviewBody: No cushion and the rivots for the shoelaces fub on my ankle bone even with thick socks. I'm a long standing fan of Hoka, but that might be a thing of the past :(
review.name: Not What They Used To Be!!!

review.reviewBody: Am impressed with the waterproofing of this boot and I find it perfect for hiking, field work, and zookeeping. Super comfortable and plush.
review.name: Great boot, perfect for hiking and field work

name: Kaha 2 GTX Hiking Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody: Great medium weight top. Fit is pretty true. I like the zippered pockets. Overall, I'm super happy with this Hoody
review.name: Right gear for the job

review.reviewBody: First off, the quality of the fleece is great. Love the colors as well. However, fit is made for tall skinny dudes. I'm average build, 5'6. The fleece is long, pass my buttocks. If you're like 5'8 and above with long torso, this fleece is for you.. Bought the medium size and no way will I exchange for one size up because then the sleeve and everything else will be super long. This fleece is definitely between a slim and regular.
review.name: Great Material but fitting was not.

review.reviewBody: I wore this thing way more often than I should admit. It's cozy AF and I want a few more of them.
review.name: Need in more colors

review.reviewBody: Fit, fabric weight, and functionality was just as expected. I am 5'-8" 140lbs and the small fits perfect for an inner layer or close layer on warm days. Hood fits perfectly under a helmet. When the hood is worn without a helmet it turns with my head so I never feel like I am having my view cut off.
review.name: Just as expected

review.reviewBody: Great layer for skiing. I wear this over a wool base for backcountry. Good wind protection and breathable. Love that the hood fits comfortably under ski helmet.
review.name: Great layer

review.reviewBody: Good fit. Wish it were a little softer but love it.
review.name: Good fit. Wish it were

review.reviewBody: I ordered the green version - really nice, fit is perfect - I am 6"2" 165 and I ordered a medium.
review.name: Perfect Fit, Great looks

review.reviewBody: I bought this hoody because I liked the configuration of the hood. I was not disappointed and am very pleased with what I consider a very technical piece.
review.name: The hood is important

review.reviewBody: Recently purchased this on line. Piece is well made and has functioned well as a mid layer during the fall season here in Canada. Great fit, warmth and breath ability.
review.name: Great mid layer

review.reviewBody: Just took this hoody on a five day trip in Joshua Tree - it worked great as a light layer keeping me warm in the mornings and evenings, and was durable enough and cool enough to wear in the daytime on the rock. Hood works great with a helmet.
review.name: Light and warm

review.reviewBody: I love these shorts and believe they're the best on the market. I also own the 5" length, and I hope a 3.5" or 3" is available in 2025!
review.name: I would buy this product again and again

review.reviewBody: Wore these shorts on a 45 mile 5 day backcountry backpacking trip in the wind river range in Wyoming (Cirque of the Towers loop). Absolutely loved the shorts! Super comfortable and i also went swimming in them to test them out and as advertised they dried very quickly. The waist band and liner took alittle longer to dry but not worth dinging my rating for it. I will be purchasing another pair or two for backpacking, workouts and playing pickleball!!
review.name: Highly recommend and will buy again

review.reviewBody: I use these shorts for my daily runs. They are extremely lightweight and do not chafe. They are a little pricy but worth it. Great for race days!
review.name: I would buy this again and again.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Extremely lightweight and very comfortable. Great pockets for gels and keys. Great for hot runs, dry fast. Material is super thin.
review.name: Total comfort

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Took them for a run. Super light, breathable and worth every penny.
review.name: Great buy

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Feels like I'm wearin' nothing at all. Geared towards runners for sure, but I use them for workouts. Only reason they aren't my favorites is the pockets, but I knew that when I bought them. Lightweight and no chaffing so I'm calling it a W.
review.name: Stupid sexy Flanders

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The shorts feel light, breathable and don't chafe me. I have no complaints. I would like to see TNF come out with a version that has a compression liner with a built in pocket instead of a brief. I like to run with my phone and I have to keep it in my vest instead when I wear these shorts. As a result I reach for a competitor brand for all my shorter runs. Not a drawback on the product itself. Just some food for thought.
review.name: Light and Cool

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great running shorts, comfortable, good pockets - BUT - zipper broke after 3 runs.
review.name: Great shorts - not great zipper

review.itemreviewed: Keb Loft Insulated Hooded Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: I used this jacket for hiking on day and the middle of the upper back where I sweat, stained the jacket. I had to return it because it would not come out. I think it is a bit pricey for this jacket. You definitely need to layer underneath. The material is soft and the fox tag is cute. Wish I could have kept it
review.name: Soft and cute but had to return it. 🥹

review.itemreviewed: Keb Loft Insulated Hooded Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: There are many things I love about this jacket, but I'm very disappointed in the pockets. As per your description, they are open. I should've paid more attention to that. I hate that they do not zipper close. There is one breast pocket with a zipper, which would be great if I could keep my phone in it, but I have a pacemaker and it cannot be that close to my phone. Additionally, no woman wants a chest pocket with a lot of stuff sticking out in it. If only you had put zippers in the other two pockets, it would be a perfect jacket.
review.name: Disappointed

review.itemreviewed: Keb Loft Insulated Hooded Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: I got this as a gift. It’s perfect for the cool mornings and running around! I love that it packs small and easy to transport if needed! It’s soft, and fit my broader shoulders without feeling constricting! Def one of my favorite jackets this season. I’m 5’8/185 and the XL fits great!
review.name: Great run around and travel jacket

review.itemreviewed: Keb Loft Insulated Hooded Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: I purchased this jacket to replace my old comparable arcteryx down jacket.  I love the fit, warmth and weight much more than the arcteryx.  I bought the xs (5’ 110lbs) and have room for light layering underneath.  On the shortcomings vs the arcteryx,  I wish the hand pockets had zippers and the cuffs were more substantial than an elastic band.  I usually buy black, but I got the dark blue and I’m so glad I changed.  Overall, i Love it and would buy again.
review.name: Would buy again maybe a size smaller

review.itemreviewed: Keb Loft Insulated Hooded Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: I absolutely love this jacket for its versatility, softness, lightness and warmth. It is very cool looking and I agree with all  the very positive reviews below!
review.name: Keb Hoddie

review.itemreviewed: Keb Loft Insulated Hooded Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: I love my Keb hoody. Lightweight yet warm enough to keep as an essential layer in your pack for when the weather changes! I keep this layer on me for every season. From skinning and powder days, to spring fishing, biking and camping, this layer is with me always!
review.name: So versatile!

review.itemreviewed: Keb Loft Insulated Hooded Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: I wear this jacket 8 month out of the year! I wear it inside as a sweatshirt and outside while biking or ski touring. It's a synthetic fill (prima loft) with a high warmth to weight ratio making it very packable. I also find that it is a bit dressier in appearance than comparable styles from other brands. The chest zipper pocket is quite big. I can fit my Iphone, keys a and a small wallet inside. The hip pockets are also deep enough that I can leave my phone in there while biking and not worry about it falling out.  When it gets below 30 degrees, I switch over to my Keb Touring Down Jacket. I tend to run cold in body temperature.
review.name: My favorite midweight jacket!

review.itemreviewed: Keb Loft Insulated Hooded Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody:
I've had this jacket for a couple months now; it's come along on a few great treks through the mountains and also been a great lightweight cold weather jacket on my walks to work in Boston. I recently took a trip to the Grand Canyon, in which we did an 11 mile hike with 3,000 ft of elevation gain. That's when I really got to see the beauty of this jacket. The night before our trek it had snowed 6-8 inches and the snow was still coming down as we were going out in the morning. It was about 28 degrees with wind chill but I knew as we descended the temps would rise to about 60 degrees. I layered up with my Singi Merino Henley as a base layer, a lightweight vest as my mid layer, the Keb Padded Hoodie as another mid layer, and then a shell as my outer layer for the precipitation that was still coming down. It didn't take long into the trek for me to start shedding layers but the Keb Padded Hoodie stayed on almost the entire time. It's lightweight and extremely breathable so even when the temps got to around 50 degrees I still found myself with this layer on. When I did decide to take it off, I only had a 9 liter pack on my back so it's packability came in extremely handy. 

I would highly recommend this jacket for every day use and for trekking. It's a necessity for me on any trek that requires a jacket layer.
review.name: My go-to jacket for layering

name: Keb Loft Insulated Hooded Jacket - Women's

review.reviewBody: Very disappointed as they are making a very loud deep buffering sound while driving and we've since had to remove them. I've tried all ways to install but no luck. Please help if the Thule team has a suggestion?
review.name: Thule Snowpack extender racks
comment:
Thank you for sharing your experience with Thule SnowPack Extender. 
I understand how frustrating the noise created by some rooftop accessories can be. This is an unfortunate side effect of using products that generate a high amount of air resistance, such as Thule SnowPack Extender. The wide, flat face of the carrier will present a barrier to wind passing over the vehicle, causing the buffering sound. Removing the carrier using the easy-to-use SpeedLink assembly when not in use is advised, but the addition of a Thule AirScreen XT fairing can also reduce wind noise.

review.reviewBody: Everything is fine except the noise when you drive the car without ski in the tops. It means if the thing is empty. Noise come out when you drive more than 85km/h. Noise is like whistle。
review.name: Unexpected noises
comment:
Hello Adian,
Thank you for sharing your experience with Thule SnowPack Extender. I understand the noise generated by this accessory can be frustrating at high speeds. Unfortunately, this is likely to happen with any additional accessory added to the roof of an otherwise aerodynamic vehicle, particularly one with a large flat plane and a gap in the middle that prevents even air flow. This is one of the reasons Thule recommends removing accessories like Thule SnowPack Extender when not in use. Doing so should eliminate any additional noise.

review.reviewBody: good quality product that is easy to install and use.
review.name: slide out ski racks on our Chevy Suburban

review.reviewBody: Extremely high quality, well made with great easy to follow install video.
review.name: Very well made, easy to install

review.reviewBody:
If you use without ski or snowboard on it, it will have a very loud noise that hurt your ears. 
And i just found out the noise is from the slide. I recommand use the regular one without the slide.
review.name: Noise!
comment: Thank you for sharing your feedback on the Thule SnowPack Extender. I understand your frustration with the wind noise generated by this system. This is unfortunately a limitation of adding accessories to the top of the vehicle. Anny additions will disrupt the aerodynamic profile of the car and can cause wind noise. The addition of a Thule AirScreen XT fairing or removal of the Thule SnowPack Extender when not in use will reduce the noise.

review.reviewBody: That rack works great, love the product but customer service is poor. Also YouTube is much better than the written instructions.
review.name: took a while

review.reviewBody: Without any snowboards or skis in the rack, this unit is very loud when on the freeway doing 60+ mph.  There is an awful whistling noise while driving that I cannot identify.  Everything is installed and positioned properly as are the rubber liners provided to close all gaps.
review.name: Very loud!
comment:
Thank you for sharing your feedback on the Thule SnowPack Extender. I understand your frustration with the noise generated from this accessory. Regrettably, additional wind noise is a side effect of adding any accessory to a set of aerodynamic crossbars, particularly one that has a large, flat profile. 
When unloaded, air passes through the rubber gaskets on the Thule SnowPack Extender and creates the whistling you described. This is common when the aerodynamic profile of the vehicle is disrupted by any larger object and is one of the reasons Thule recommends removing accessories from the vehicle when not in use.

review.reviewBody: I was told that I could install the roof rack system and when the instructions came I could not come close to completing it.  Also shipped additional parts that were not needed, adding to the confusion.  Thule should make a detailed video explaining everything in a twenty minute video.  Adter wasting an hour and having the first piece on loosely which I did not know how to tighten or take off I was lucky to find a shop that would help.  Two hours later it was complete so we thought except later to find out that the side rails were put on backwards.  The pieces could come labeled better as well with how they are marked in the instructions as well.  Shocking how difficult this was to install and the instructions so bad that it takes hours for a professional to do it.
review.name: bad instructions, good product

review.reviewBody: Product fit perfectly with my new car.  Highly recommended
review.name: excellent fit

review.reviewBody: I love this bag, my family used them on a recent trip and used it as a carry on. plenty of space for boots, helmet, outerwear, and gloves.
review.name: Awesome bag!

description: Buy the Adventure Medical Kits Mountain Series Medical Kit online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Mountain Series Medical Kit
hasVariant.description: Buy the Adventure Medical Kits Mountain Series Medical Kit online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Was looking for a large medical kit. Found the Adventure Medical Kit on the backcountry.com website. The 10 person 28 day kit showed up and the only price option was $17.99. I selected 2 kits @ $17.99 each, and felt lucky to have found such a great deal. The photo that shows up next to my order is the 10 person 28 day medical kit. However, I received 2 of the Day Tripper Lite kits. Even now when you select the Day Tripper Lite kit, it shows the Mountaineer kit which is the 10 person 28 day version. I contact customer service via chat and after explaining myself multiple times. The backcountry rep offered to exchange the med kits, but then told me that I would have to pay full price for the replacement kids. I have no use for the smallest kits, and would never have ordered them. I am not a happy customer.
review.name: Received the wrong item

review.reviewBody:
This is a handy kit, but I feel misled by the picture on this product, as it is for the mountaineer series kit which includes things that the options here do not include. I got the explorer kit for $70 and I can't help but feel that I could have put this together for $30 bucks and some time in my medicine cabinet. I am going to add to the kit to round it out, which means I probably should have just put together my own kit from the start. 

The organization of it and the helpful booklet for different scenarios are quite nice though.
review.name: Not worth $70

review.reviewBody: A Medkit is a must for anyone heading into the Backcountry and I have an Adventure Medical Kit in every one of my backpacks. Even their larger kits are compact and well organized, making it easy to find what you need quickly in a stressful situation. Definitely don't head out without one.
review.name: Essential.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Thankfully I’ve not had to use it but I have if if we need it.  We go ATV riding and hiking.  It is compact enough we can throw it in our bags and not think about how heavy it is.
review.name: Sure compact

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I knew I needed a compact first aid kit for my family, but I struggled with how to piece it together and always ended up packing way more than we needed.  My family and I love to camp.  There are always events when we camp that arise that require basic first aid.  Fortunately, never worse.  This kit is perfect for all of our needs.  I love it.  It is easy to pack and everything inside seems to be made and packed with care.
review.name: Love!  Perfect for Camping Family

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] My family and I love to go hiking, mushroom hunting, backpacking, etc. We also have a medical kit with us in our bug-out bags, car, and any backpack we take with us. We took this one with us up mushroom hunting. This has most anything we could need. It is also compact and lightweight. I used a carabiner to attach it to the outside of the backpack so it would be easy to get to. I love how organized it is. We are looking in to getting some of the other varieties, especially one for our dogs.
review.name: Perfect addition for any outdoor enthusiast

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Definitely came in handy during our trails. Has everything you could possibly need for a emergency especially if your kids are with you and they start to panic, size is perfect for your backpack or purse.
review.name: Perfect size.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I was waiting for someone to get hurt.  I had all the supplies I needed to perform a surgery.  This kit was packed with all of the essential bandages, ointments and tools that I would need in any situation.  I needed this kit and it can handle any emergency that comes up.  I’m prepared for bullet wounds, stabbing, skinned faces or any accident that comes my way!
review.name: Get hurt please

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I'm not a outdoor person by a long shot but I do know that you should always have a emergency first aid kit on hand!! I'm really liking this because when you open it, each section is organized and labeled for finding it fast! It has all of the items listed on the back just in case of a emergency. This will definitely come in handy in my household and we appreciate it!
review.name: Great Features

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This little first aid pack is great for any small camping trip it has all the basics for scraped needs to burns. I would definitely recommend this to all my outdoors and nature friends.
review.name: Great for small camping trips

name: Mountain Series Medical Kit

review.reviewBody: Worn this for hundreds of miles. Have the Proton Icon also. Wanted to love it. Fits great (a touch larger than the proton). Looks cool. However - the front forehead pad is like a sponge. The pad gets DRENCHED with sweat and it just runs into my glasses. I’ve never had this issue, this bad, with any other helmet. You basically need to wear a hat or bandana to make it bearable. I can’t understand why they didn’t just use the printed rubber that the other interior pads have. IMO it to the point where I would pass on this helmet.
review.name: Forhead pad is a disaster

review.reviewBody: I bought the Elemento looking for a road aero type helmet—plus it was a great price based on my LBS price.  The helmet has great air flow and covers my very bald to balding head from the sun.  But it does not fit my head probably due to shape.  I had red marks on my scalp where the pads were pressing tighter than others.  I did not have the helmet on wrenched down tightly.  If it had not been for the fit I would have loved to kept this helmet—although white color would have been more preferable.
review.name: Nice style and air flow….

review.reviewBody: I want to love this helmet.  The fit (for me head) is perfect.  Its not as well ventilated as other helmets, but the real issue is the padding or padding arrangement that channels sweat directly into my eyes.  As in there is no absorption in the padding.  On warm days my glasses are entirely opaque with dried sweat.  Had to put this one on the shelf and swallow my $400 worth of tears.
review.name: Sweat Lodge

name: Elemento Helmet

review.reviewBody: Lightweight, easy to pack and assemble. Can't get any better than this for a shovel.
review.name: Great shovel

review.reviewBody:
This is my go-to shovel anymore. 
I timed myself multiple times utilizing a larger blade d handle style shovel and found I was faster and less tired using the smaller lighter shovel. I got 5 years of a lot of use out of one before I decided to retire it to a parking lot car shovel. I highly recommend this shovel for folks that carry shovels resort skiing due to its compact blade and handle and lightweight
review.name: Small but mighty

review.reviewBody: Lightweight, packable, useful for not just skiing. Have used to dig pits and my car out of the snow. Careful that the shovel tip doesn't tear anything - I haven't had it happen but could see that being an issue if not careful.
review.name: Great product

review.reviewBody: Perfect small and light shovel that is still sturdy and effective

this is a great shovel. it is lightweight, packs up nicely, fits in the bag, and is simple. the only issue is it doesn't have a really flat end so it can be hard to make perfectly straight pits. but for what the shovel is most important for, digging out of an avalanche, it would be ideal.
review.name: Great shovel

review.reviewBody: It balances size and weight well. It’s not the bigger blade, but it’s big enough and packs well.
Great shovel fits in a small pack and lightweight.

Light, packs well, cuts through crust well. Doesn't move as much snow as heavier larger and more ergonomic shovels but that is the trade you are getting with a light shovel. Good mount points for a snow anchor. Easy and fast to deploy but the spring buttons have a tendency to ice up after extended use such as digging a pit and require some finagling to detach the shovel head from the shaft after use.

This shovel is an auto-include for any snow excursion. Lightweight and compact, it fits great lashed onto any pack or outer pocket, and feels sturdy when fully expanded.  I have even used it to dig my car out after a snow storm. The ONLY complaint I have is that the handle is just a touch short (you also can't side on this shovel like a sled if that's something that's important to you).  If you're looking a great snow shovel to take with you or keep in your car, look no further!
review.name: Amazing tool for the money!

review.reviewBody: Handy little thing. More durable than you would think!

name: Alugator Light Shovel

review.reviewBody: I was hoping these were a bit thicker. But, sadly they're a thin summer weight. I have not used them yet so can't comment much on the durability or performance. But, I will keep them anyway because they look and fit great. Based on the size chart I would were a XXL, however after reading the two reviews I ordered one size down and the fit is perfect!
review.name: I will keep these

review.reviewBody: Castelli socks are my favorites, but I will second the other reviewer who states the sizing chart is way, way off. I wear 45 sidis and the 2xl socks were ridiculously big even though the chart says that’s my size. I didn’t bother returning them. I like Competitive, but I’ve told them of an obvious shoe chart sizing error in the past and they never bothered fixing it,
review.name: Sizing chart is off!

review.reviewBody: Sizing is way off here. I wear a 44 road shoe.Size chart told me to go 2XL. Not even close. Way too big. The heel pocket comes all the way up to the middle of my achilles. Im a big Castelli fan boy and own a ton of their stuff but this just is not acceptable. I just wasted $40 here on 2 pairs of these with CC because I threw away the tags and packaging because figure how could tgey screw up sock sizing.....Welp....there I go.....Quality seems decent otherwise.
review.name: Sizing off

name: Bandito Wool 18 Sock

I usually wear a medium and went for a large and it fits prefect, I just don't like clothes that are too fitted.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Fits nicely exactly what I wanted. Color is nice but I expected more of a red color. Overall a nice vest for fall weather in the Chicago area. One more thing  it kind of fits tight with a sweatshirt on.

review.reviewBody: As mentioned by others it runs on the smaller end for the size, European slim fit. Sits well, has 2 pockets and even ships with a patch kit. It should not be worn as outside layer, no scruff or rain protection. That allows for light weight and soft comfort.

review.reviewBody: Great vest. Great quality. Runs small. Ended up ordering a different vest.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Another great all round everyday sports vest for any occasion.

review.reviewBody: Great for outdoor walkings and hiking on mountains.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Feels great, stylish, something’s Terrex run small on me, this is one of those items. I have several jackets and coats, some fit great in medium (usual size) but some I have to size up. I actually have a Terrex coat which is XL, so be ready to exchange. Or buy one of each size if it’s a popular item and return one.
review.name: Too snug to layer

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] perfect for winter to spring transition time. good fit in neck area with closed zipper.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These pants were recommended to me by a dog walker/trainer. They do not disappoint. In rain and snow I stay dry walking my dog. They also protect from wind. I ordered a larger size than normal so I could fit other pants underneath comfortably. Saying that, I do not even need the drawstring on the pants so other reviewers may be accurate regarding small fit. I love these and am trying to figure out other uses. Perfect.
review.name: They work!

review.reviewBody: Bought these for both work (landscaper) and fun weekend camping trips. I recommend ordering a size larger, unless you don't plan on layering underneath. So far, they've been great in wet conditions (ie: after rainfall, being outside and working with wet soil) but I have yet to wear them during a strong rainfall or storm. In a light rain/drizzle or in post rainfall conditions, they've been great so far!
review.name: Haven't worn them in a downpour yet...

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Kept me warm and dry in rain and snow. Awesome in wind as well. Worth every penny.
review.name: Great pants

review.reviewBody:
I have not worn these in the rain, but purchased during sale for Montana winter. My mud boots and thermal underpants fit perfect under these. I love the zippers!! I’m very happy with it!!!

True to size. Excellent quality and confort. Lightweight, windproof and durable.
review.name: great product

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Precip Rain pants are waterproof in a light rain.  Haven’t used them in a downpour yet.  They run large in the waist.  I gave this medium to my daughter who is 5’6” and 140.  They fit her well over sweat pants.
review.name: Precip rain pants affordable and comfortable

review.reviewBody: I recently ordered these pants to help me stay dry during our rainy Fall and Spring seasons. I'm a little disappointed that the waist band is really tight compared to the way the rest of the pant's fit. They are quite expensive to be so far off in sizing. Since you have to wear something under them, it is necessary that the waist be designed better.
review.name: PreCip Eco Pant

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love the zippers. I've taken these on several hiking and backpacking trips and they've worked will every time. The extra ounces is worth the piece of mind in not worrying about getting too wet in flash storms.
review.name: Great waterproof pants

review.reviewBody: I bought these to keep me dry walking the dog in our neighborhood and they keep me dry and protect me from the wind. I like the zipper pockets. After reading the reviews I sized up and I wish I hadn’t, they are quite baggy and a bit on the long side but they serve their purpose.
review.name: Rain and wind pants
comment:
Hello,

Thank you for providing us with a feedback on our products. We truly appreciate you bringing the matter to our attention.
We are very sorry to hear that the item has not met your expectations.
 
At Marmot, we strive for excellence and we set a high standard for ourselves, and we’re so sorry to hear this was not met in your interaction with our brand. We greatly value our consumers' insights, which are collected and shared with our product development teams for consideration. We appreciate your effort and do hope that you will reconsider using Marmot products in the future.
 
We are happy to assist in resolving any issues you may experience with our products.
 
If you have any more questions, please reach out to us via https://www.marmot.com/support/contact-us or through LiveChat. We’re available Mon-Fri, 9AM - 5PM EST
 
Thank you,
Marmot Consumer Care

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These pants are great for windy and rainy days. They are comfortable and easy to slip on. I even like them to wear on my daily walks when there is a slight breeze.
review.name: Great pants!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I'm a bike commuter in the northeast (where, as the old adage would have it, if you don't like the weather, just wait a minute). These pants are part of my everyday kit--they fit over my work clothes, they aren't constricting--I can bike in them--and they keep me dry. Couldn't live without them. (By the way... I initially ordered a Large based on customer reviews suggesting that the pants run small. I did not find this to be the case at all, and had to return the Large and order a Medium.)
review.name: Perfect rain pants

name: PreCip Eco Pant - Women's

review.reviewBody: The Fusion line is supposed to be Giordana's "entry level" line, but nothing about the fit or quality of this bib suggests that. I am short with an athletic build and really struggle to find things that fit well because I don't have a typical body type. This bib fits and looks great in my normal size. It's compressive but comfortable enough to be a good daily driver. The Chamois is high quality and comfortable for the 60+ mile rides I do and the construction feels durable and long-lasting.
review.name: Sold on Giordana

review.reviewBody: I like the fact that when you turn the shower handle off, the water stops flowing. I also like how instantly hot the water gets. In fact, we barely turn the propane on and the water is hot. A few times, the temperature of the water was almost a little too hot. I just had to adjust the propane gas a little and it adjusted.
review.name: I am impressed how easy it was to hook up and use. It instantly gets hot and the water pressure is great.

review.reviewBody: Simple use——water heats immediately, water temp gives a read-out immediately, quick connects and disconnects for incoming, outgoing and gas. All parts are heavy——not cheap. This is a great product. Completely satisfied!
review.name: I wish I could explain how wonderful your product is! Well designed, efficient, mostly it WORKS. And it works easily. LOVE IT.

review.reviewBody: A hot shower on day 2 of a festival is a total game changer! Love the Hottap!
review.name: Game changer!

review.reviewBody:
Good 👍&#55356; 
Nice unit. I needed some help setting up but got that easy. Have not used it much yet but it’s worked fine all setup. 🙏&#55356;👍&#55356;👍&#55356;
review.name: Good!

review.reviewBody: I like the plug and play aspect of unit just add water and propane and it’s good to go
review.name: Hot water is such blessing when you live a little rougher than most people

review.reviewBody: I think its a great thing to have with you out camping away from home. Its easy to set up and take down. I especially love the pump to use water from streams or any body of water around you.
review.name: My shower

review.reviewBody: Great product and easy to set up. Works perfect with my build and will be a great addition to my remote travels.
review.name: DIY Overland Trailer Build

review.reviewBody: I have no idea, I bought the unit expecting to have everything for my hunting trip in the Wyoming mountains. It does not come with a pump, who would buy a portable water heater to use at home were you can connect it to a hose. Yes, I should have looked closer. But, again, why would you sell a device that does not work without buying the pump separately. My entire group was very disappointed. I will be returning unit. It was never used.
review.name: Did not work when I needed it.

review.reviewBody: The Hottap is super portable. Lightweight. Easy to set up. Lots of hot water. Better pressure would make it awesome. I wish it had come with the cover and/or the bracket included in the kit. Also wish the cover unzipped so the cover front could be flipped up. It would be convenient to be able to zip it just enough to protect it but leave hoses attached at the bottom. Highly recommend!
review.name: Outdoor Shower

review.reviewBody: The bolt that you tighten by hand that's supposed to hold the support legs in place snapped in two the first time I used it. Still no word on receiving a replacement.
review.name: Hot water, but poor quality

name: HOTTAP Essentials Kit

description: Buy the Altra Experience Form Running Shoe - Women's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Experience Form Running Shoe - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Altra Experience Form Running Shoe - Women's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I bought this shoe when it first came out and after trying it for a few weeks, I was worried it might sell out. It is the best sneaker I have ever had, no kidding. I don't even have to put my orthotic in it after 3 months of wear and I cannot believe it. My foot specialist recommended it to me and it was the best I have had.
review.name: Like walking on clouds

review.reviewBody: I love Altras but running in zero drop shoes hurts my knees and lower back. The Experience Form is just what I needed! A slight drop and a wide toe box; the best of both worlds! No more pain! 5 stars!
review.name: Experience Form-The only shoe I'll ever run in!

review.reviewBody: I had to return . Not enough toe box room. I have purchased from you last year. just can't get that same fit like before.
review.name: Returned

review.reviewBody: I have ordered Torrins in size 8, but in this shoe, I felt like Cinderella. Currently awaiting the 8.5 and absolutely can't wait because the shoes felt like a dream (even though they were small). Can't wait to run & train in these!
review.name: Runs Half Size Small

review.reviewBody: The toe box is a perfect width but the hight of the toe box is not deep enough which causes the shoe to put pressure on the top of the first and second toe. Uncomfortable fit.
review.name: I won't buy this product again.

review.reviewBody: The cushy craze is not normally my thing because I feel like I'm falling off of the sides, but I love my Escalantes so much I thought I'd give it a try. Glad I did! Cushioning is just the right amount of comfort and offers enough feeling of contact with the ground that I need to feel stable. Hope they stay in rotation!
review.name: Built for comfort

review.reviewBody: As someone who healed her plantar fasciitis with daily foot stretching and wearing THESE amazing shoes, I'm a convert. Please don't mess with a good thing. Roomy toe box and perfect heal toe drop!
review.name: My new obsession

review.reviewBody: I got these shoes because after ankle surgery and months of recovery, I could only walk about 20 minutes without pain using other shoes. I bought these because my foot is still swollen and these shoes have a large toe box. Within a week, I was walking 45+ minutes at a time. I'm delighted with the comfort of these shoes. I bought a half size bigger than my normal walking shoes which currently are too tight. I will definitely buy Altra shoes again.
review.name: These shoes are amazing

review.reviewBody: These are my all time favorite shoes!! They have helped my feet with plantar fasciitis. I walk a lot and spend hundreds on shoes that I thought would help but these were the only ones that worked the best
review.name: My all time favorite shoe

review.reviewBody: Best sneakers I've ever owned I have had plantar fascitis all my life. I am now 189lbs lighter and leaning to run! I live and love These sneakers!!
review.name: Yes I would buy them again and again

name: Experience Form Running Shoe - Women's
