review.reviewBody: These shoes feel very comfortable. i use them mostly for walking and occasional very short jogs. The fit is a little narower than other Altras and the length feels a little longer. I tried half sizing down but they were too narrow/tight. The bad: The materials for this shoe are not durable. I started getting a hole in the left shoe before 30 days and now a hole in the right shoe shortly after 30 days. The hole is where your toes bend in the shoes. I cannot recommend this shoe given the cost how quickly they deteriorate
review.name: Good fit and comfort poor quality

review.reviewBody: Well I saw the writing on the wall and bought 6 pairs of Torin 4.5s and I just unboxed my last pair today. Please, please start listening to the people that were loyal to your brand and it's not just me, I know a lot of people that have changed to Topo but like many of those that have tried the arch support of Topo kills me. I've tried many iterations and models of Altra and the Escalantes and the Torins have fit best altough not sure about the Escalante 4 since I bought mulitiple of the 3 since I liked them and the reviews of the 4 are not as strong as the 3. Have other COMPLETELY separate models if you are trying to get more market share for the masses, but I'm running (didn't know that pun was going to happen) out of options and I so far haven't found another brand that fits better. Hoping you can get back to your roots with the fit that got you a following in the first place. Cheers, Richard
review.name: VF Factory could you please quit screwing up Altra????

review.reviewBody: I was happy with everything on the Torin 7 except for the rigid plastic in the heel. Feels ok with perfectly straight walking or running, but any lateral movement or uneven ground forces the hard plastic in the heel to dig into my ankle below the protrusion on both the medial and lateral sides. Loved the way the Torin 6 and 5 had a soft heel counter. Hopefully on the 8 they can fix this.
review.name: Plastic In Heel Extremely Uncomfortable

review.reviewBody: I've been testing these out with 5K tempo runs. The fit is familiar as I started in Altras with the Escalante Racer (6/5 would recommend). Despite fitting well I found other Escalante models (2.5 & 3) to feel like running with planks on my feet. The Torins show very little of that problem so far. The midsole feels responsive but not cushy or bouncy. The energy return seems fairly low. Generally I don't mind these things but I am having doubts about making them my marathon shoe. I wish there was a standard footshape version of the Vanish series. Make it so! I've worn the Provision 7 and found them to less responsive but to feel a little more cushy compared to the Torin 7. The fit of the Provision was slightly tighter in the toebox and overall not quite right. Enough to be uncomfortable over a longer run (10K+ for me). So far the upper is fine. Heel hold is good. Midfoot feels secure but not constricted. I have not had them long enough to note much else other than they are all PLAIN. I hope you are hearing this a lot. Altra, you need better color options. Think brighter, go nuts, give me more COLORS. I'm tired of black, white, grey, black & white, and maybe green. You actually did that with the Escalante 4!!! (Which I'm looking forward to). End rant. Torin 7: 4/5. Could be a 5/5 with some of that Ego Pro midsole. Make it so! -Tode
review.name: Familiar Fit

review.reviewBody: The Torin line (I've had iterations 6 and 7) is one of my favorites for running and general use. That is, while they last. Both pairs have literally started falling apart inside 4-6 weeks of wear.
review.name: Perfect, while they last...

review.reviewBody: Extremely comfortable show with great cushioning. I trained in two pairs of the Torin 6 version for a marathon and have found my forever brand. Normally a size 13 in most brands, but a 14 in Altras.
review.name: Fantastic show, Altra does it again

review.reviewBody: This is my 3rd pair of Altra Torin. I love how they feel on my feet. There really is no break in period. They feel great right out of the box. I dig the new color options! Need more Wide Options colors.
review.name: 3 pair of Altra Torin

review.reviewBody: Lovely feel but had to buy bigger size (US12 vs US10.5 for Newtons). Would love an even wider toe box as I have bunions. The cut and comfort of the Torin 5 Leather is my ideal. The Torin 7 would be 5 ⭐️ if the toe box is as wide.
review.name: Almost perfect road running shoe except for ...

review.reviewBody: I have only been running in these for the last couple of weeks, but I love them so far. I run long distance, and my feet feel great due to the wide toe box and ample cushion. Love them!
review.name: Exactly what I needed!

review.reviewBody: The torin has been a favorite of mine for years. I've had 6 pairs previously. I skipped a few generations based on poor feedback and decided to try again for the 7. The width is not the same and narrow
review.name: So close but not the same. Disappointed.

name: Torin 7 Shoe - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Steens II Hooded Fleece Jacket - Boys'
review.reviewBody:
This fleece hooded jacket is an excellent choice for those kids who love to stay outdoors. The material is soft, cozy, lightweight, and provides just enough warmth during cooler weather. It's a versatile enough piece of garment to wear on its own or layer under a heavier coat on colder days.

It fits great, neither too tight nor too loose, and allows kids to move freely during all of their activities. The hood adds extra protection from the wind, and the pockets are perfect for warming hands or storing small treasures. It is also very durable and holds up quite well after repeated washes; it stays soft and looks like new.

If you’re looking for a reliable, comfortable, and stylish jacket for your child, this one is a 5-star pick. Columbia delivers excellent quality every time!
review.name: Great Quality and Comfort for Active Kids!

hasVariant.description: Buy the Peak Design Everyday Messenger Bag online or shop all Travel from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: This bag, especially in black looks quite professional.  It is loaded with features that make it perfect for commuting to the office or going out with all your camera gear.  The design and organization in this piece of gear is really well thought through.  I love that you can remove and adjust the gear dividers.
review.name: Professional looking, but with lots of features

review.reviewBody:
This is the perfect size bag for taking to the office when I just need to bring my MacBook and a few other office essentials. 

Also, this ideal for taking to smaller photo shoots or when I'm traveling and I dont need or want to carry too much gear. Perfect for carrying a Laptop, Camera Body, 1 or 2 lenses and a Flash unit. Plus, I can strap on a travel tripod (ie., Peak Design Travel Tripod) if needed.
review.name: Perfect size

review.reviewBody: Bought this for travel, and I use it everyday too. Super easy to convert the inside and fit camera plus more without being bulky.
review.name: It’s a classic for a reason!

review.reviewBody: I have been using Peak Design Everyday bags for several years. I love the quality of the materials they are built with. I recently got the Everyday Messenger 13 LT and it doesn't disappoint. I will be testing it in several field trips that I'll be going soon.
review.name: Very nice bag. Excellent fabric and design.

review.reviewBody:
Hello, I would like to tell you how satisfied I am with using my Every Day Messenger.
It's been over 3 years and I use it every day to go to work. it is perfect and adaptable. he endures all the bad weather because I travel by motorbike and he is strapped to the Sissy Bar without being protected. 
as I use it a lot it got worn out when closing. I spoke to Peak Design about it and as it has a lifetime warranty, they changed it for me so it wouldn't tear. Well done after-sales service.
review.name: Great Every Day Messenger bag !

review.reviewBody: So I got this bag under a warranty claim on my version 1 messenger bag so can compare directly. The bag is nice and feel very sturdy. It should last the test of time. They've done away with the rubber on the strap which is what caused me to claim on my warranty from version one so this is a welcome change. The new inserts are better and have more configurations than version 1 and are more sturdy. Downsides to this bag is I think it's about 20% smaller than version 1. The front pocket is substantially smaller and they've done away with the red and green stitching on the pockets which was great for knowing which pockets contained used memory cards and batteries and which were good to go. They've replaced that with a notch or light grey stick hinge and a notch of dark grey.. so I guess you'll have to decide which one means which and remember it.
review.name: Improved on version 1 in some areas

review.reviewBody: sometimes if I'm in a bad mood and I open this bag, I want to throw it across the room.  The top flap is so annoyingly stiff that it won't stay open when reaching in and out of it.  I also long for the old days when there was a 15L (or even larger) messneger style bag.
review.name: Not big enough and too stiff to open

review.reviewBody: i have purchased a lot of bags professionally over the years but always come back to this one as an easy carry for a pro body with lens attached, a tele and a wide angle plus a flash. Perfect size for it and prevents you from over packing. Still looks as good as new after many years of use.
review.name: Keep coming back to this bag

review.reviewBody: I have purchased both the 3L and 6L. My first purchase was the 3L for carry while doing street photography. Just the right size for second Ricoh GR and essentials i.e. batteries,  The 6L injust recently purchased to carry while doing macro to carry extra lenes. Both the 3L and 6L are very well made, comfortable carry strap and as a bonus look nice.
review.name: Right size and comfortable fit

review.reviewBody: I have the 6L sling but wanted something a bit bigger for a longer trip. Thought about the 10L sling but decided on the messenger. So glad I did. Much more room and a much better layout for me.
review.name: Really well designed.

name: Everyday Messenger Bag

review.reviewBody:
About 35 years ago, I traded my French hardshell helmet--the only hardshell on the market at the time and perfect for mountain biking--for the first American hardshell I found, the Giro Hammerhead.  It was half the weight of the French helmet, and had a thin hardshell and excellent ventilation.  A few months later I went down in a low water crossing, slamming the back of my head on the slippery concrete, and rode away due to the excellent protection. I replaced it with the same helmet and kept replacing it with Giro's for a number of years. I'm coming off about 10 years of Specialized's previous Ambush usage and might have stuck with that model had they not changed it so much. So, looking around, I found this helmet, read up on it, and bought it.  And July in Texas is a good test for ventilation and general comfort.
Ventilation? Excellent. Better than the Ambush, and the Ambush was really good.  Comfort? The frame snugs around my head, the padding is pretty minimalist but is very comfortable.

I'm still tweaking the adjustable rear frame, because if the helmet doesn't sit just right on the head, the front vent rails are in one's upper vision. The visor, too, doesn't really come down as far as it should for early morning light.

Still, it's very comfy, great ventilation and I wouldn't hesitate to buy again.  Just like my original Hammerhead
review.name: The Newest Hammerhead?

review.reviewBody: So happy with the fit. I thought it would fit like the spherical ski helmets. I bought a small and it’s very tight. I also wear a cycling cap under for the visor. I ride early or later in the day and seeing in the forest can be a scary experience.
review.name: Good Helmet. Ineffective visor

name: Merit Spherical Helmet

description: Buy the Big Agnes Torchlight 20 FireLine Core Recycled Sleeping Bag - Kids' online or shop all Kids from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Torchlight 20 FireLine Core Recycled Sleeping Bag - Kids'
hasVariant.description: Buy the Big Agnes Torchlight 20 FireLine Core Recycled Sleeping Bag - Kids' online or shop all Kids from Backcountry.com.

review.itemreviewed: Torchlight 20 FireLine Core Recycled Sleeping Bag - Kids'
review.reviewBody:
Let me start by saying, I generally have liked Big Agnes products in the past.  In fact, my daughter uses a prior year Torchlight sleeping bag and likes it very much.  I decided to stay within the series and try this one out - and it's an over-designed miss for a kids sleeping bag.

My problem is both with the bag AND the marketing description, write up and features.  

First of all - the bag materials and fill quality feel good.  Some extra kid's specific features - not necessary, but fine.

The downfall of the bag is that there is zero insulation along the back of the torso of the sleeping bag.  Zero.  It's two thin layers of poly rip stop.  That's it.  It's not like they missed the fill in that zone, it's apparently designed that way, due to the fact that it CAN be used with the attached sleeping pad sleeve.  It's great to have a sleeping pad sleeve / holder - great feature for a kid to have, but there are situations where the padding and the insulation of the back torso are wanted... for instance, sleeping on a queen mattress and rolling to one's side...

So basically, by removing the insulation on the back, they've pigeon-holed a child to only be able to use their sleeping bag, with a perfectly sized sleeping pad (sold also by Big Agnes).  It's a single use case scenario... which for a kids sleeping bag is not ideal - whereas it should be more of a universal thing for 99% of the population.  

My second gripe about this is that nowhere on the backcountry.com site is there anything about the lack of back insulation.  There is no mention that a sleeping pad is REQUIRED to be paired with this bag.  It's obvious it's an option with the design of the sleeve - but zero mention of the necessity to have on for comfort.  I went back and checked extensively.  The only place it's even mentioned on the Big Agnes website is in a small icon, buried in the features accordion - not even mentioned as a disclaimer or anything in the main bullet points.  

I feel that neither backcountry or big agnes did their job to properly communicate and inform parents of the critical details of this sleeping bag - that it is part of a required system... And it's also disappointing that BA didn't just include a few more ounces of fill in the back - it wouldn't have been a deal breaker on weight, packability, or cost.  Ultimately, it wouldn't have impacted it's ability to used as a system or as a stand alone piece.
review.name: Total miss - Classic Overthinking

name: Torchlight 20 FireLine Core Recycled Sleeping Bag - Kids'
Torchlight 20 FireLine Core Recycled Sleeping Bag - Kids'

hasVariant.name: Heron 11XT Kayak
hasVariant.description: Buy the Old Town Heron 11XT Kayak online or shop all Paddle from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Folks, if your looking for a stable, straight tracking, comfortable kayak weighing at 42lbs this baby is for you. I have been doing this for quite a while now and have had a lot of good kayaks. Some were longer and some shorter, all had their good and not so good.  One and larger chop, cross winds and both at the same time and my 11xt has handled it all with the grace of a well designed boat. Cudos Old Town and thank you Lancaster marine for keeping me on the water.  68 years old and still doing what I love best.
review.name: Treasure on the Chesapeake

review.reviewBody: This is my second year with this kayak, I love the simplicity, stability and spaciousness. I tried a more expensive and better rated kayak, but after a third try, I decided to stick to my Old Town.  I like that I can stretch my legs or sit cross legged. The hatch has plenty of room. I appreciate that it only ways 41 lbs, making it easier to load and maneuver on the water.  On one occasion, I ended up in a river with a bit more action than I expected, but it performed quite well, leaving me to feel safe.  It takes more effort to travel in a straight path in strong winds, but not more so than other more expensive kayaks who boast being the best.
review.name: Love my Heron 11XT

name: Heron 11XT Kayak

description: Buy the Rab Solar Ultra 3 Synthetic Sleeping Bag - Women's online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Solar Ultra 3 Synthetic Sleeping Bag - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Rab Solar Ultra 3 Synthetic Sleeping Bag - Women's online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.itemreviewed: Solar Ultra 3 Synthetic Sleeping Bag - Women's
review.reviewBody: Honestly, I wish I hadn't bought it. I can understand why it would work for some people however I stand at 164cm so not very tall and it is very small. I also only sleep in a hammock so there isn't much room to move but I often feel constricted if I have the hood up. Lying flat in a tent may work better. Having just done 2 large hikes sleeping in temperatures ranging 0 - 7 degrees, I doubt that I would be comfortable in -13, and I am equipped with a very good sleeping mat and thermals. I slept comfortably but could feel the cold. I would say the EN rating is accurate on this one and saying that, there are cheaper and larger Rab sleeping bags that stuff down to a much smaller size that would have been more appropriate for me. It doesn't come with a net sack for storage and the stuff sack is not the same design as the other Rab sleeping bags I looked into and it is not as practical either. I don't really understand why they use this stuff sack as it doesn't allow making it as small as possible. The bag is comfortable and warm however just not for me. If I hadn't left the country I would have preferred to exchange it as I do like other Rab products.
review.name: Honestly, I wish I hadn't

name: Solar Ultra 3 Synthetic Sleeping Bag - Women's

hasVariant.name: MicroMo Stove
hasVariant.description: Buy the Jetboil MicroMo Stove online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: reliable and versatile.   The adjustable regulator makes it a perfect compact camp stove that you can use pretty much any pan or pot on it.

I've used this stove for two years now and I'm extremely happy with it. I to had issues with the lid not fitting correctly. I bought a lid for the zip and it fits perfectly no more fit issues great stove
review.name: great stove

review.reviewBody: Very portable, lightweight with big features. Works great in the snow and at elevation.
review.name: Great Stove

review.reviewBody: I have been so impressed with how quickly this boils water (which is what I bought it for). I can boil enough to hydrate a meal and have a cup of coffee ready before the food is. Best part is that it fits so well in my daypack and hunting pack that I don't mind carrying it. A hot meal or drink is great as it gets colder in the woods.
review.name: Great little burner!

review.reviewBody: It’s a good little stove and boils water quickly and is easily adjustable to simmer which is the biggest difference between it and more simple jetboil products. Small click ignited worked in my garage but could not get it to work while on a recent three day backcountry trip even when completely sheltered from wind. I always have a couple lighters so it isn’t a big deal, but I could see it being very frustrating if you didn’t have one.
review.name: Great, but igniter doesn’t work outside

review.reviewBody: I've been looking at these for some time and pulled the trigger on the MicroMo. I was a little apprehensive about the size, it turned out to work perfectly for my needs. The only thing keeping me from giving 5 stars is that the lid will not stay on, not a deal breaker, but still a minor issue
review.name: Good Enough

review.reviewBody: Water boils in a minute, I used it for a two night camping trip, it was used for coffee and water for oatmeal. I made the mistake of overfilling it, don’t make the same mistake. Easy to set up and use in general.
review.name: Works as marketed

review.reviewBody: I'd used a friend's non-regulated Jetboil on some other trips, so thought I'd give this a go for a 5 day canoe trip in the BWCA. For morning drinks and freeze dried meals boil time was under 2 minutes which is what I expected out of it. Where it really shined was when it was time to fry some walleye fillets and hasbrowns. The regulator and fry pan stand worked great together. Temp control was perfect and the non-Jetboil fry pan I'd brought with was plenty stable. My only regret is having waited so long to upgrade!
review.name: Did everything it should, super fuel efficent

review.reviewBody: This is the perfect size for a couple cups of coffee or small meals.
review.name: Perfect size

review.reviewBody:
hello, We recently bought this product with high expectations as it was highly recommended to us, BUT, after using it for less than 10 times as disaster was about to happen!! the wind came out of nowhere and directed the fire to the bottom part (Plastic part) of the stove and it started a fire in that part!! LUCKILY I was checking on it to see how it is going with the wind and guess what?! it was on fire!!! it damaged the whole plastic part and the ignater.. Buying such an expensive, high end (supposedly) product, shouldn't be made of such flammable material!!! so disappointed.. a refund or replacement is demanded..

Please reach out to me for images.
review.name: DISAPPOINTED!!
comment: Thank you for your review. We are very sorry to learn about this melted shroud piece. For warranty assistance, please have the burner assembly on-hand to provide Lot code info and contact Customer Service at 1-800-572-8822 M-F between 8am and 4:30pm EST.

name: MicroMo Stove
MicroMo Stove

review.name: Great product

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love these shoes for mountain biking. I can tell they are made well and will last me a few years!
review.name: Great biking shoe

review.reviewBody: I was looking for shoes for bike and walk and this are cool. Very comfy
review.name: Cool

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love the look of these shoes. They are a bit stiff which is great for bike riding.
review.name: Very happy with these shoes.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Wife just loves wearing them riding. She loves the look, the sneaker feel and comfort and the grip on the pedal.
review.name: Perfect cycling shoe for my Wife

review.reviewBody: Comfortable shoes for biking around the city and trail. Good quality and true to size.
review.name: Comfortable and true to size.

review.reviewBody: Haven’t used them yet but they seem very durable and comfortable
review.name: Durable

review.reviewBody: I was looking for a pretty bike shoe without cleat attachment.  Love the style, fit, functionality of these - just rode 20 miles in them, and went for coffee.  I wear a 9.5 running shoe and, while I was nervous following the size guide (fine print indicated 88% chance of being correct), the recommended size 9 was spot on.  Toe box is just right.  The sole is appropriately rigid for my riding purposes; I did not have foot fatigue after ride and also was able to walk in them without issue.   Only bother is the "Adidas" logo tab on the top of the tongue, which sticks up beyond the tongue by about a quarter inch - you can see it in the picture of the shoe.  It is fairly rigid at the tip due to stitching and serves no purpose that I can see (maybe some run laces through it).  I wear low socks and it lightly rubs the bare skin just above my ankle crease.  Going to remove it and happily ride on in these great shoes!
review.name: Love the style, fit, and functionality!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The product sizing is WRONG!!! Says size 10 but is a 9 at best.
review.name: The product size is WRONG!!!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These are really cute, the color is more muted and not a bright lime green which is really nice. I find them a little hard to get on but I probably could have went a little larger. I went a half size up but they fit just a struggle first. I absolutely love these sneakers though.
review.name: Cute and comfortable size up!

review.reviewBody: Fit is so comfy & the fabric is so soft.  I wouldn’t run in this but everything else works perfectly.  You don’t slip around, it fits snug but you don’t even notice you are wearing it.  And it’s easy to get on & off.
review.name: Love these tops!

review.reviewBody:
I have a larger chest and a smaller mid section. This had zero support which is fine but the fit was also strange on me. I have broad shoulders and this still hit me super high in the arm pits and very high on my chest. It was just not flattering on me while also not providing support so I am returning it. 

I’m 5’8, 165 lbs, DD, ordered a large
review.name: Quality fine, fit not for me

review.reviewBody: This is a great bra for working out. I don't like a lot of compression/support as I find it uncomfortable. This is just the right amount of support and love the breathability and adjustable straps. Also love the color. Great price! I hope they make more of these. Huge fan
review.name: LOVE!

review.reviewBody: I got the Give and go bikini briefs (2 pairs) and the square neck bra top for backpacking underwear gear and I absolutely love them. The bra is so comfortable and fits perfectly, and is long enough on the bottom that I feel comfortable wearing just that as a top when I'm out in the woods. It dries quickly. I wanted something that could double as a swimsuit so I don't have to carry as much on backpacking trips. And the give and go bikini briefs fit really well and I love the fabric. I'd like to replace most of my underwear with these, even for everyday wear. Highly recommend this brand. And not overly priced either, well worth what you're paying for them.
review.name: No regrets

name: Square Neck Bra Top - Women's

review.reviewBody: I have a few older pairs of the Sport Mesh Thong that were absolutely the best. I've been trying to find a replacement since they don't seem to carry that exact style anymore. I love the fabric and the overall cut, but the waistband is strangely thick and tight in comparison to the old style. Still, much better!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great underwear for hiking. Breaths well and runs true to size. Be careful not to put them in the dryer as they makes them deteriorate more quickly.
review.name: Great for hiking

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I'm not one for buying thongs, but I'm glad I did. It's comfortable, breathable and not constraining like other brands or styles. I would recommend this to anyone and it's true to size too.
review.name: Breathable & Comfortable.

review.reviewBody: These thongs used to be the best, the fit was amazing, and they lasted for years. Now, the cut is too low and the band cuts across the hips in a tight, unflattering way, even in a larger size. Also the band used to be softer. I guess they are fine if you are thin and wear low waisted pants? But if you have hips and wear leggings or joggers these are unsuitable. Please bring back the higher waisted thongs!
review.name: Awkward fit, used to be great

review.reviewBody: The most comfortable underwear I've ever worn - now in a thong form for when you don't want panty lines! I've been a fan of their underwear for many years and refuse to wear anything else. I bought some of the men's briefs for my man and now he's a die hard fan as well.
review.name: Comfort AND no panty lines!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is the best underwear that I have ever owned! The cut is perfect for wearing under short shorts or high waisted bottoms. No panty or thong lines and the sides don't roll. The fabric is weightless and it's really true that you can take 2 pairs and go anywhere! One to wear, one to spare! They dry overnight and don't stretch out. I just want more colors.
review.name: Minimalist to the Max!

review.reviewBody:
They're fine approach shoes except for their fatal flaw, which is the reason I'm selling mine and switching to something else - they're notably easy to roll an ankle in! 

I've had about 3 friends roll their ankles in these or other Scarpa approach shoes, and I just did as well, pretty dang badly. Basically, the sole is narrower than the foot part, and they're so stiff that once you start to roll, it's game over. 

Bummed because they fit my wide feet better than most other options for approach shoes. Beware!
review.name: easy to roll ankles

review.reviewBody: I’m a fairly new surfer and this board was a great forgiving board for me. Versatile in bigger and smaller waves. Be aware it is a very fragile board.
review.name: Great surfboard

review.reviewBody:
Sadly it arrived with the nose dinged cause the cardboard housings inside the box that are supposed to protect nose and tail are assembled with big copper staples and the board hit these during normal transportation and handling. The staples are actually placed at the bottom of the cardboard housings but somebody flipped one over (upside down) along the way, probably during customs inspection, so the nose due to its concave shape, matched the exact position of the staples and got screwed up.

This is definitely a package design flaw. There is no warning or indications on how to carefully place the housings back into the box that can alert any one who inspects it's contents. For shippers or customs would be really difficult to figure out that the packaging it self can damage the product if they don't re-pack everything back carefully (original factory packaging). This is not the responsibility of  Back Country but Global Surf Industries Packaging designers'. 

UPDATE!
I also noticed some kind of small dings along the right rail, near the tail that have already been filled with resin (look a bit yellowish and with some bubbling), probably a repair done at the factory. These boards are made in Chyna, which I'm not a fan of for many reasons, just so you know.
  
 I reported this incident to Backcountry CS and they kindly offered me to return the board or to keep it and receive some cashback via store credit just to cheer things up. I can't return the board cuz it has already be shipped abroad. So I accepted the cash, a big Shout out to  my boys/girls...or any 'alphabet people' (LGBTQ+-&$#*...or any other weird character) from Backcountry for stepping up and backing up their products and services. I will certainly will do business with you soon, since my wife is already looking for a new board for her.

I contacted Global Surf Industries to let them know that there is a potential risk of the staples used to assemble their  packaging and nose/tail protecting housings,  causing damage or dinging the boards, specially if someone flips upside down any of the two cardboard housings contained inside the shipping box, when reassembling everything after inspection and standing or resting it nose-down, perpendicular to the floor.  They said "It's not convenient for us to do such changes and bear the costs of redesigning the packaging" : (
review.name: Modern Falcon 8'
comment: Sorry to hear about that mess Joe! But so glad you reached out to us and we were able to help you out with that store credit. Have fun out there!
People at Backcountry are not just boys.

review.reviewBody: I?ve been riding this board for a while and with a 7 ft version of this board you can get glowing longboard rides along with turns when you want
review.name: Great for beginner-intermediate surfers

review.reviewBody:
I was stoked to try out this board but it came damaged on arrival. I ordered the 8 ft plain white version. Got delivered with a FAT hole in the lower half. Unacceptable to ride. Also was informed that someone would call me when it was being delivered in order to ensure I or someone else would be there to both receive and inspect it for holes/dents/any damage but they didn?t call me. No one informed me that it 
was delivered. Came home from work to unpackage it with a hole. It didn?t resemble a dent from getting bounced around but a hole as if something sharp had jabbed it. This is unacceptable to ride in the water. I?m sure this board would?ve been great but I am extremely disappointed and frustrated with backcountry. I understand things get bounced around in transport especially something as awkward and long as a surfboard but if it?s quality checked and packaged the right way it shouldn?t have these issues at all. Be cautious when ordering this board, not because of the quality of the board but the quality of this companies packaging.
review.name: Damaged on arrival.
comment: I'm curious too.  Did BC make it right?
Hi - Did backcountry accept the return of the board or did you have to pay to have it repaired? I am worried this will happen if I order a board :(. Thanks in advance!
I had a very similar experience with another board. Horrible packaging. Damaged upon arrival. It could have been avoided for sure.

name: Falcon PU Surfboard

description: Buy the Jones Snowboards High Sierra Touring Pant - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: High Sierra Touring Pant - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Jones Snowboards High Sierra Touring Pant - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Just got these so I don't have snow experience to report but I thought it might help somebody if I report on the sizing.  I am a 5'9" woman weighing 160 pounds and I sometimes buy mens pants if they are better than the women's and almost always I get the mens Large, which then fits me but has a little room or extra length, which I don't mind.   

OK well these pants fit closer to a mens medium and I am not sure the sizing chart is 100 percent representative for how they fit.  I thought the large might be a little roomy in which case I would have layered lightweight wool long johns underneath for winter use.  However they fit just right as a slim fit garment with not a lot of room for a base layer.  This is fine because I can wear them just as pants for errands.  I was going for the Jones brand and this seemed to be a good pair of pants.

The waistband is not overly bulky.  It will look slim and fitted if I have a shirt not tucked in.  

The guy in the photo is slender and has no rear, which makes the pants hang loose and roomy in the hamstring area.  I do have a rear so for me the pants are fitted (not tight).  The fabric is smooth and stretchy so not tight anywhere.

There is no extra length for me and I doubt the inseam is a true 33 for the mens large.  It seems a 32 because it comes right down to my ankle.  The cuff is a little bulky but will fit well over a boot for winter walks or (for me) cross country ski boots. 

The fabric is not heavy.  The front pockets are large.  I don't need zippered back pockets but they exist.  The tag says this fabric is "no noise" and that seems true, - good idea!   It is anti-wrinkle and has a smooth hang to it.  

The logo embroidery is nice looking and it shows up twice - on the front pocket and also down by the boot cuff. 

Bottom line is the pants are good but to get the fit as seen on the model you will have to either order up a size or be very skinny.
review.name: I think they run a bit small

name: High Sierra Touring Pant - Men's

hasVariant.name: Bristlecone MF Sleeping Bag: -10F Down
hasVariant.description: Buy the Western Mountaineering Bristlecone MF Sleeping Bag: -10F Down online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Foremost just realize this is not an UL bag so if you try to take it on a UL trip, that's on you!! I bought this for car camping, and dispersed. My slow season is the winter time so I do my camping mostly then. This is a roomy comfortable bag and has served well in 40f- -15 f conditions car camping in Colorado in FEB. If you want basically an extremely lofty goose down comforter that wraps you completely, this is it. It also unzips to a very large size of you need to use it in warmer temps as more of a comforter.
review.name: This isn't a backpacking bag!

review.reviewBody: I have used this bag on every outdoor endeavor that cold may be a factor. It is heavy and large, not well suited for back packing but I have used it in temperatures ranging from 30 degrees F to -10F and the bag has been comfortable at every temperature plus the freedom of movement is tremendous. I highly recommend for people planning on sleeping in the wild in sub freezing temperatures in situations where you are not required to pack the bag on your back...or you accept that most of your pack volume will be taken up by a sleeping bag.
review.name: warmest, most comfortable bag

review.reviewBody: This freaking thing is huge...not easily rolled up and put in a pack. The material is so slick your hands and fingers slide all over the place trying to roll it up when it's cold. It is next to impossible to roll it into the bag without having someone lie on the thing while you are rolling it and once you do, the thing takes up nearly 3/4 of my 65L pack. This bag is meant for cold weather camping in an Airstream, not for backpacking or mountaineering. Very disappointed. Understand the bag is described as "burly" but it is also unwieldy.
review.name: Not a backpacking or mountaineering bag.

name: Bristlecone MF Sleeping Bag: -10F Down

review.reviewBody: I'm 5'8 and 122 lbs.  The mediums were huge.  Will return for an XS.  Otherwise, very cute pants. I like that they are heavier material.
review.name: Runs a little big.

review.reviewBody: The Norrona Lofoten GORE-TEX PRO Pant is my go-to ski pant on cold weather storm days. They are perfect for frigid, snowy days when you can't afford to have wet legs. Warm, breathable and bomber, they will keep you outdoors taking endless laps when others head for the lodge. Multiple deep pockets to store anything and everything that you need for a storm day outdoors. The hip to ankle taped side zips will allow you to vent when necessary. The huge kevlar inner ankle will not tear when struck by ski edges. Even in sub zero temps, when coupled with Arcteryx Rho base layer you will not get cold. The one thing that I do not understand is the waist zip. These pants should be sold with a powder skirt; otherwise there is no need for the extra zip.
review.name: Excellent harsh weather ski pants

review.reviewBody: I'm a huge fan of Norrona, but these pants are just too heavy/burly for my usage. They are very heavy (more so than the Lofoten Pro jacket). So, sent them back. Love the Lofoten (non-Pro) except for the  placement of the zipper/zipper tracks
review.name: Good if you want boom proof heavy pants

review.reviewBody: I love these pants, they're my new resort pant. They are a bit thicker then a typical shell pant, keep you a bit warmer. They feel very durable and I am stoked on the fit. I got a size small and I can tuck all my layers into the pant while skiing. I got the orange/ blue color and get so many compliments on the hill.
review.name: Love them

review.reviewBody:
I love these pants. They are burly yet not too heavy. I ordered the orange alert/blue fog color and they are very unique. The pocket placement is great. 

Size wise I ordered a size medium which is my normal ski pant size. I am 5-5 135 lbs, usually a 27 or 28 in jeans.  I have fairly narrow hips. The waist fit comfortably with room to go larger or smaller with the velcro adjustment.

I only wish I could figure out a way with the bib attached to open them up to use the bathroom without taking all my layers off. I know I will have these for years to come.
review.name: Perfect

review.reviewBody: Norrona quality is legit! These pants fit more like men?s snowboarding pants. Not necessarily a bad thing but fyi. The tan color was really nice but ultimately there were three things that caused me to return them but I really wanted to love these high quality pow ready pants. One - they have a zipper around the top of the waist band. Didn?t notice in the pics before ordering. This would be rad but my jacket and these pants are both the same side of the zipper (your jacket should still have a zipper on it when you remove the pow skirt to be compatible). 2nd the pants are reinforced at bottom and super bomber but inner gaiter felt soft and like I might tear it with my clumsy gloved boot adjustments. 3rd the thigh pocket gusset created a sporadic thigh pinch which I couldn?t ignore at this price point.
review.name: Mostly good but returned

name: Lofoten GORE-TEX PRO Pant - Women's

hasVariant.name: One Key System

hasVariant.name: One Key System
hasVariant.description: Buy the Thule One Key System online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Charging this amount of money for something that should have been INCLUDED in the original system and is this cheap to produce is UNREAL. I will tell every soul I know to never buy Thule products EVER. What a load of you know what. Not sure if this soon to be worth zero business is owned by some private equity vampire squid cockroach sith darklord screwing customers but if this business wants to retain customers over the long term (it doesn't....) then it would not do this. Seriously, an absolute JOKE. You clearly only care about FLEECING customers. Good luck in your future; likely you will need it.
review.name: ABSOLUTE JOKE - PURE AND SIMPLE THEFT

review.reviewBody: Theseare great but for 8 locks it only came with 2 keys
review.name: Very nice to have

review.reviewBody:
Ordered a set of 8 keyed-alike locks.

Pros:  Product arrived on-time.  The locks were easy to install / swap out.
Cons: Only received two keys with the eight locks.  Would have been nice to get a one or two more keys with the 8-pack.  Unable to order additional keys from the Thule as the website continually shows them as out of stock, and the availability date keeps getting pushed out.

I'm going to say Yes to recommending the product due to the convenience of having everything keyed alike.  But REALLY frustrated in not being able to get additional keys.
review.name: Need to provide more keys

review.reviewBody: I replaced the original plastic pins that came with the Thule roof basket with these locks and The new metal locks were very difficult to insert into the cover in place of the plastic pins. Got two of the locks in place after spending about 30 minutes. A week later I tried again and I finally got the other 2 locks installed after fighting with them for a good while. Now that they are installed I don't think I will ever remove them. What a hassle and over priced.
review.name: Difficult to insert into cover

review.reviewBody: Perfect fit and easy to install.  Why can't they just be included with the bike rack from the start?
review.name: Easy to Install

review.reviewBody: Install was easy and works very well. Shipping was fast and easy.
review.name: Perfect fit

review.reviewBody: It is an awesome opportunity to manage to keep all locks under one key, make life so simple. And even the product itself. Very simple and easy to change the lock cylinders to the one key set up. Thank you Thule for coming up with it!
review.name: Great set up!

review.reviewBody: I'm now borrowing the Thule rooftop bike racks friends of ours own, to temporarily mount to the top of our Subaru Forester for transcontinental travel.  They did not have lock cylinders for the rack-to-car clamp on their car, so I bought two.  The little black box of locks and keys that came had no sign of instructions, and the usage of the "blank" master key eluded me until after I had gotten the first lock misinstalled 180deg out of its proper position, locked non-functionally into the rack.  I recovered with a flashlight, close inspection, and a tiny screwdriver, but I would much have appreciated getting written instructions with the new locks.
review.name: Lock Cylinders Came without Instructions

review.reviewBody: Works as advertised. Convenient having only one key.   Very fast shipping.
review.name: Very fast shipping

review.reviewBody: First time Thule purchaser and very happy with all the products. The one lock system was easy to install and use
review.name: Easy to install and use

name: One Key System

review.reviewBody: These pants run small compared to other kuhl pants. Definitely order a size larger. They are very tough and durable but DO NOT HAVE ANY STRETCH. After the first wash in cold water and dryer on low temp I  was very disappointed in how they disfigured. They will be uncomfortable if you don’t size up when buying.
review.name: These pants run small in size

review.reviewBody: These arrived with “fade lines“ all over them. Didn’t notice till later, so couldn’t return them. Fit is on the small side and very prone to severe wrinkling. The material is very stiff and uncomfortable.
review.name: Weird, fade lines and weak snap

review.reviewBody: I've had a lot of Kuhl garments over the years, but this one missed the mark.  After washing, there is a weird color streak that almost looks like creases.  Won't go away, even after repeated washes, and prompt hanging out of dryer.  Also, the snap button doesn't stay snapped!  Very frustrating!  These are going to be relegated to shop pants, rather than be seen in public pants.
review.name: Not as good as previous versions

review.reviewBody: The fabric is heavy duty and perfect for exploring.  My husband loves them.  I get a size bigger for him because he likes a baggier fit.
review.name: Great outdoor pant

review.reviewBody:
this is the second pair that the zipper has failed on. the teeth came out on the zipper. i am not fat and know how to use a zipper.

going to try some velcro on this pair

kuhl did replace the 1st pair but it is a very long and difficult process
review.name: beware the zipper fails

review.reviewBody:
I would love these pants, except that the snap is terrible, my pant open up all day long, in fact they just opened up as I sat to write this review.  I would return if I could but I wore them for a few days.  
The fit is a little off from what I use to be. The Free Rydr 32 fits like old Rydr Lean 31.
review.name: Kuhl Free Rydr

review.reviewBody: I should have read the reviews before purchasing. As stated in some of the other reviews, the snap is ridiculous. It wont even stay snapped with a belt on! The wrinkling is also crazy, even after a number of washings, the fabric won't lose the wrinkles.  I'll wear them in my shop but not out, as originally planned. I will give a plus to the feel of durability! Perhaps after a lot more washings the fabric will soften and start to the wrinkles like a fine pair of jeans.
review.name: Should have read the reveiws

review.reviewBody: Kuhl had a great product going, then completely ruined it by not using a traditional pants button. Instead, these pants have some snap button contraption that comes undone even with a belt on. I got a size larger than normal and, although I originally blamed my winter weight for the issue, the button will easily come undone even when not wearing the pants and simply pulling on the waistline. When pull the waistline apart with any tension, the snap button comes undone. Why could just a normal button be used? Don't waste your money
review.name: These could have been great

review.reviewBody:
He LOVES this pant. He never wears shorts so in the Arizona heat these pants are perfect and ventilated. He is a plumber/repairman and they are perfect for work and hiking. The pockets are perfect for a cell phone on the side pocket. I literally just bought is 4th pair. 
I have to say they look great on him too!
review.name: Just bought my boyfriend's 4th pair

review.reviewBody:
These pants are almost great. Here's the breakdown and I hope KUHL is reading:

Pros: Style, Fit, and Quality Construction. I feel like they will wear well for many years.

Cons: I ordered two pairs of these pants (in different waist sizes) and they were different colors but marked both as "Dark Khaki". One version was lighter brown with contrast tan stitching and looked like the photo. The other version was darker brown with matching stitching. I don't know what say about that, I can't reliably know which one is correct or which version I would get the next time. Con #2: The fabric is soft on the outside but very itchy and rough on the inside. I steam-washed the pants several times and I'm sure they will be great long-term, but hard to love in their first month. Con #3: The snap closure is idiotic and constantly comes undone. This happened even on the pants I ordered that were too big in the waist. For the pants that fit me correctly I can't keep the snap snapped. Who makes snaps anyway? I'm a skinny guy, it's not that the pants are too small. I will either sew my own button on (if I love the pants enough after a month) or I will return them. For me, this is a disqualifying design flaw.
review.name: Almost Great

name: Free Rydr Pant - Men's

review.reviewBody: The Salomon S/Pro Alpha 130 LV are great boots! This is my first pair of 130-flex boots and I’m getting them dialed in now on Day 2. First day I skied them with the stock insoles and they were wobbly feeling and sloppy, but then I had some shims put in and I added my Sidas insoles and the difference is huge! I have to unbuckle periodically to relieve pressure on the toes of my right foot, but I hear this is part of the break in with stiff boots. Once I added my Sidas i soles and did 3 teeth on the instep and cuff buckles, the comfort was great. Recommended.
review.name: Sick Boots!

review.reviewBody: Incredibly stiff and responsive on-piste boot. Went with custom insoles but didn't bake the liner or shell, and my ankles have been locked in from day one. Believe the hype!
review.name: The hype is real

review.reviewBody: Exceptional fit for a narrow foot with high instep. Provides high performance without compromising comfort
review.name: Great performance ski boot

review.reviewBody: The fit of these boots is incredible! The initial last is nearly perfect for my lower volume foot  but the Custom Shell feature/molding made them perfect the first time! Then I skied them. From the first turn they blew me away...what a weapon! Precise edging, progressive flex, awesome power transmission, and intense snow feel!
review.name: Awesome Boots

review.reviewBody:
I don't have a wide foot or even an average width foot so most boots that I try on feel really comfortable until I actually go to make a turn and then I realize I need to clench my toes to keep my foot from sliding around. 

The new S/Pro Alpha boot actually grips my foot the way a "narrow" boot should while not bringing flashbacks or dare I say nightmares of the old blue Lange race boots that ruined free skiing for me and so many others. 

This new boot is a blend of my favorite Salomon boots. The heal pocket is snug while the toe box has just enough room for my feet to stay warm. The flex is stiff and responsive for ripping high soles turns on groomers but not too stiff to enjoy in the trees and moguls. The liner feels great around the ankle and the tongue of the boot wraps around my shin just right. It's like the Salomon S/Max met my old Salomon Falcon boots but somehow feel more comfortable than both. 

After skiing these for 35+ days in temps from below zero to 65 above I'd like to give them a 5 star review for fit and performance. 

The only thing I would recommend is stopping by your local ski shop to get the custom liner and custom shell heat molded to your foot shape! Also, I always pull out the footbed and get a new custom footbed shaped to my foot and the boot for absolute comfort and control.
review.name: Did they just make a boot better than my S/Max?!

review.reviewBody: The boot fits as big if not bigger then the s pro. The only good thing is it is easy to put on. we need the fit of the smax back
review.name: boot is too big
comment:
Thanks a lot for your feedback! 

Please do not hesitate to contact our Customer Service if you need assistance with your product!

review.reviewBody: This boot gives instant feedback. Very quick to drive energy to the ski.  New instep and custom shell makes for a comfortable and precise
review.name: Very precise

review.reviewBody: The S/Pro Alpha 130 exceeded my expectations in just about every way possible. I can’t say enough good things about the fit. I have a very narrow foot and skinny lower leg and I have a hard time finding a low volume boot that fits well. The heel pocket is beautifully designed, and provides a really nice grip. I never had an issue with heel lift at any point! The fit in the forefoot is really nice for a low volume boot. With a slightly wider fit than its predecessor (S/Max,) it gives your toes a little more breathing room, but it never felt loose. I described it as being snug where it needs to be and comfortable where it can be. I also really enjoyed the relocation of the instep buckle. I ski mostly east coast, but always spend a few weeks to a month out west every season as well. These boots were perfect in every condition I tried them in, from the boiler plate groomers of western New York to blower pow days in Utah. Flex felt perfect in every condition I tested them in. I put 50+ days of hard skiing into these boots and they did not blow out or get sloppy at any point.
review.name: Performance Meets Comfort

review.reviewBody: I found that the S/Pro Alpha feels great, fit comfortably out of the box, and delivers better precision than my old  S/Max.  These boots had virtually no break in time, and the adjustments are easy to use.  I primarily ski Sugarbush, and it is often icy.  The response and feel of these boots are both great, and they made even the hairiest conditions manageable.
review.name: Sweet!

review.reviewBody: I got these kinda late in the season so I have only skied them a few times so far. They were very snug fitting and comfortable with great "snow" feel and response.
review.name: S Pro Alpha 130
